En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una chica de 11 años que estudia en colegio. Todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella es modista, aprendió esta profesión en un centro artesanal hace varios años.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser toda clase de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora ropa para niñas las mismas que coloca en una vitrina para la venta. Además de su taller de costura también tiene una papelería  en su mismo local el cual atiende al mismo tiempo que realiza sus trabajos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, lleva 5 años en su negocio y gracias a Dios nunca le ha faltado trabajo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande con mas maquinas y operarias y, mejorar su papelería.
texts.en:
In the San Pablo parish of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí [province], known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the "Unión Y  Solidaridad" ["Union and Solidarity"] communal bank meet every fifteen days.

In this place we meet Rosa, who is 52 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have five children: four who are already grown, and a girl of 11 who is in school. All of her children still live with her. Her husband is a merchant. She designs and makes clothing, a profession she learned at a handicrafts center several years ago. 

She has a small tailoring workshop in her home, where she has worked for many years sewing all kinds of clothing. She works by fulfilling orders from individuals, and she also makes girls' clothing which she arranges in a showcase for sale. In addition to her tailoring workshop, she also has a paper goods shop in the same location, which she operates at the same time while doing her sewing work. She works every day from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m., and sometimes even later when she has orders to deliver. She has operated this business for 5 years, and she says that "thanks to God," she has never lacked for work. 

She will use this new loan to buy fabrics, thread, buttons and other materials for tailoring. She has been with the communal bank for 5 years, and she likes it because she started her business with the first loan. 

Her dreams are to have a bigger workshop with more machines and workers, and to improve her paper goods shop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, buttons and other materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 62 años, es una mujer perseverante y muy correcta en sus acciones, ella hace muchos años se separó de su pareja,  con el que tiene un hijo, que ya conformó su propio hogar, por ello vive sola en su domicilio propio, ubicado en el caserío de Huaylahuichan. A pesar de la edad y de vivir sola, aún tiene metas que alcanzar porque el motor de su vida es su hijo y porque ama las tierras que la vieron nacer y crecer, “aquí yo crecí comiendo choclo, papa sancochada, cancha, en otro lugar no me acostumbro, porque me molesta el ruido de la ciudad y acá siempre tienes que comer” cuenta Juana, quien se dedica a cultivo de maíz, papa y arveja, en los terrenos que le heredaron sus padres. Ella trabaja sola, lo que más le gusta es sembrar alfalfa porque después de cortarlos, retoña hasta cuatro veces y puede durar 3 años con buena producción, “tienes que regarlos cada 8 días”, comenta. A la vez  cría 150 cuyes  en su vivienda, que vende al por mayor para consumo (carne) y producción (cría). Según cuenta está vez vendió un buena cantidad de ellos por lo que pudo pagar sus cuentas. Como sus actividades son bastante rentables, está pensando vivir con su nieto Marco de 15 años, por ello piensa dedicarse al negocio de venta de alfalfa y de cuy pues quiere apoyarlo con los gastos de sus estudios. Ahora ella se está recuperando de la pérdida que tuvo en la cosecha de arveja, que vendió a bajo precio, pues se malograron por las variaciones climáticas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde manifiesta “yo no confió en otra entidad, porque nos ofrecen beneficios y al final no cumplen, además no se preocupan por ti como en está institución, donde estoy feliz trabajando en mi banco comunal”. Juana, preparará la tierra para su próxima siembra de alfalfa, pues se malogró la raíz de su cultivo por lo que no retoña en el tamaño adecuado. Motivo por lo que comprará semilla de las mismas, como también fertilizantes naturales para que crezcan adecuadamente. Y si el dinero le alcanza comprará cuyes medianos entre hembras y machos, para asegurar su reproducción.
texts.en: Juana is 62 years old. She is a persevering woman and very polite. She separated from her partner many years ago, with whom she has a son that already has his own home. That is why she lives alone in her own home, located on a farmhouse of Huaylahuichan. Despite her age and living alone, she still has goals to achieve, because the driving force of her life is her son and because she loves the land that saw her be born and grow up. "I grew up here eating corn, boiled potatoes, and dirt. I can't get accustomed to another place, because the noise of the city bothers me and you always have to eat there," says Juana, who cultivates corn, potatoes, and peas on the land that she inherited from her parents. She works alone. What she likes the most is to plant alfalfa because after cutting it down, it sprouts up to four times and can last three years with a good output. "You have to water them once a week," she comments. At the same time, she raises 150 guinea pigs in her dwelling. She sells them mostly to be consumed (meat) and to be produced (raised). According to her, she says that this time she sold a good quantity of them so that she could pay her bills. Since her activities are fairly profitable, she is thinking about living with her grandson Marco, who is 15 years old. That is why she plans to focus on the business of selling alfalfa and guinea pigs--she wants to support him with the costs of his studies. Now she is recuperating from the loss that she had in the pea harvest. She sold them below price because they were ruined by changes in the climate. She belongs to the communal bank "Nueva esperanza" ["New Hope"]. This is the 7th loan with MFP where she expresses, "I didn't trust another entity, because they offer us benefits and in the end don't follow through. Besides, they don't worry about you like this institution, where I am happy working in my communal bank." Juana will prepare the land for the next planting of alfalfa. The roots of her crop were ruined, therefore, they didn't sprout in the adequate size. She will buy seeds of the same kind, as well as natural fertilizers so that they grow adequately. And if money remains, she will buy medium-sized female and male guinea pigs, to ensure their reproduction.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds, fertilizers and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela es una madre D. familia D. 51 años D. edad, vive con sus 3 hijos y esposo en su casa propia la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos D. agua y luz, en donD. acondicionado la su sala un lugar para colocar su tienda, ubicado en la zona rural D. la campiña  La Arenita a unos 15 minutos del distrito D. Paijan,a 30 minutos D. Ascope y a una hora D. distancia al departamento D. La Libertad (Trujillo) .  Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad comercial, agricola,ganadera y turística  que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Carmela ha puesto  en su casa su tienda, en cual sus  vecinos encuentran toda clase D. productos comestibles (leche, azúcar, arroz, azúcar, todo tipo D. golosinas, etc.), con el pequeño negocio que a colocado Carmela  en su casa trata en lo posible D. brindar un mejor nivel D. vida para su familia mediante los ingresos D. sus ventas diarias.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Carmela trata D. adquirir un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda D. más insumos y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades D. cus clientes, y D. paso incrementa sus ingresos.

Carmela es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo D. que como familia salgan adelante apunta D. esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Carmela is a 51 year-old mother.  She lives with her husband and three children in her own home which benefits from the basic services of water and electricity.  Her store is located in her specially-adapted living room.  Carmela's home is located in the rural area of the countrysiD. of La Arenita, 15 minutes from Paijan district, 30 minutes from Ascope, one hour from La Libertad department (Trujillo).  These areas are noted for their high levels of commerce, farming, livestock raising and tourism.  

Carmela has set up a store in her home in which her neighbors can find all sorts of food products (milk, sugar, rice, candies, etc.)  With the small business that Carmela has set up in her home, she tries to proviD. her family with a better standard of living through her daily sales.

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, Carmela acquired a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles which she will use to stock her store with more supplies.  She will thereby be able to meet her customers' needs and increase her own income.

Carmela is known by her neighbors as a cheerful woman who is ready to help others.  She is also known as a responsible woman whose goal is to get her family ahead in life through her efforts and hard work.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to stock her store

loans.name: Viviana Azucena

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Viviana, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. El marido es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, vende ropa, zapatos y sandalias, además de  productos de Yanbal, Esika y Lebel (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Sus productos los recibe en su casa y lo que es ropa y calzado compra en el centro en una distribuidora. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien. Nos cuenta que las sandalias son muy solicitadas por sus clientes ya que son bonitas y a precios razonables.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa, zapatos y sandalias. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras le han demostrado mucho cariño y ayuda.

Sus sueños son estudiar una carrera universitaria y agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Union y Solidaridad" meets twice a month in the San Pablo parish of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  

In this place we meet Viviana, 23, who is in a common-law marriage that has produced two children aged 4 and 2.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

Viviana is a housewife who, in order to generate her own income, has a business selling products through catalogs.  She sells clothing, shoes, sandals and also products from the Yanbal, Esika and Lebel lines (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories.)  She works 3 days a week and she goes door-to-door taking orders.  She sells her products on credit and collects every week.  She receives the beauty products in her home, and buys the clothing and shoes in a distribution center.  She has had this business for 2 years, and it is going very well.  She tells us that the sandals are in great demand by her customers, since they are nice looking and are reasonably priced.  

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing, shoes and sandals.  This is her 2nd loan cycle in this communal bank, and she likes it because her fellow group members have shown her a lot of support and kindness. 

Her dreams are to get a university education and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, clothing, shoes and sandals

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, es una dichosa mujer de 35 años. Convive desde hace 13 años con Walter, con quien tiene un hijo, Kevin, de 14 años. En unión familiar ellos viven una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de Huaylahuichan.  Para sacar adelante a su hijo, que es su razón de vivir, Olinda, se dedica desde hace 13 años a la siembra de papa, arvejas y maíz, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero pues depende la calidad de sus cosechas. Su buena venta en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde además viaja todos los jueves y domingos a comercializar los cuyes que compra, vendiendo su carne a un mayor precio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder brindarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. “Me gusta trabajar, realizó muchas actividades para poder obtener mayores ingresos”, afirma. Ya que también se dedica a la ganadería, cuidando de sus vacas, carneros y cuyes, que enseba para luego comercializarlos a un mayor precio de venta. Sus planes son poder construir su casa propia, y de esa manera poder tener algo para el futuro, pues ahora puede ahorrar y hacer realidad su sueño, “antes tenía que invertir en la educación de mis demás hijos”, culmina. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva esperanza”, y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde logró mucho de sus objetivos, pues el apoyo que recibe lo incentiva a desarrollar mejores cosas. Olinda, gracias a su experiencia sabe, que en esta época del año donde se celebra “el día de la madre”, la venta de cuyes aumenta, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará 50 ejemplares, para su venta.
texts.en:
Olinda, 35, is a lucky woman. She has lived for 13 years with Walter, with whom she has a son, Kevin, 14 years old. Their family lives in a rented house in the neighborhood of Huaylahuichan. To help their son, who is her reason for living, to get ahead, Olinda has worked for 13 years planting potatoes, peas and corn. She cares for them with dedication since she depends on the quality of her harvests. She sells them in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where she also travels every Thursday and Sunday to sell the guinea pigs that she buys, selling their meat at a higher price. 

What she likes most about her job is to be able to give her son a better quality of life. "I like to work, I do a lot of things to earn more income" she affirms. She also raises livestock, tending her cows, sheep and guinea pigs that she fattens up to later sell them at a higher price. 

Her plans are to be able to construct her own home, and thus have something for the future since now she can save money and make her dream a reality. "Before I had to invest in the education of my other children" she explains. 

She belongs to the village bank "Nueva Esperanza" and this is her third credit with MFP. She has achieved many of her goals since the support that she receives gives her incentive to develop better things. Olinda, thanks to her experience, knows that guinea pig sales increase around this time of year, because of Mother's Day. For this reason she will use the loan to buy 50 animals to sell.

loans.use: to buy 50 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio, de 51 años, es soltero y vive en casa de su madre Mariana de 84 años, cuidando que no le pase nada debido a su avanzada edad, también viven con él su hermana Kely, de 17 años. A pesar de no vivir junto a su hijo William, él trabaja arduamente para poder darle la calidad de vida que se merece. Es por ello que hace 35 años, se dedica a la agricultura, pues siembra papa, arveja y habas en sus terrenos propios, que le heredó su madre, Eugenio, cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana y sus sobrinos ya que son una familia unida, siempre dispuestos a darse la mano. Lo que más le gusta de su actividad, es seleccionar la papa que cosecha de acuerdo a la calidad y el tamaño, para luego comercializarlos en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma, donde ya tiene compradores mayoristas que lo conocen. Los terrenos con los que cuenta, quiere cedérselos a sus sobrinos para que se generen ingresos económicos, que le ayude a independizarse, pues él, con sus ahorros, pudo comprarse el auto que tanto anhelaba. Dedicándose todos los días al trasporte público cubriendo las rutas San Juan de la Libertad - Tarma.  Según menciona le va muy bien, “es más tranquilo”, afirma. Asimismo desea llevar semilla de papa a la ciudad de Arequipa (costa del país), donde tienen buenos compradores. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Unión por el trabajo”, y este es la quinto crédito con MFP, donde está contento porque le brindan otra vez le ayuda de contar con el capital de trabajo que requiere, además continuará laborando en su asociación, junto a los integrantes de su grupo. Eugenio, sembrará papa de la variedad “yungay”, por ello con el dinero solicitado comprará 10 sacos de abono orgánico (guano de corral), con los que piensa asegurar el buen crecimiento de su próximo sembrío.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 51, is single living in his 84-year-old mother, Mariana’s, house seeing that no harm comes to her due to her advanced age.  Also living with him is his 17 year old sister, Kely.  Even though he does not live with his son, William, he works hard to provide him the quality of life he deserves.  Because of this, for the last 35 years Eugenio has been farming.  He grows potatoes, peas and lima beans in his own fields that his mother passed on to him.  Eugenio can count on help from his sister and his nephews because they are a united family, always willing to help each other out.

What he most enjoys about his work is selecting which potatoes to harvest according to quality and size for sale later at markets in the city of Tarma where he already has wholesale buyers who know him.

He wants to pass on his fields to his nephews so that they can earn income and help them become independent because he was able to use his savings to buy the car he so wished for.  Every day he provides transportation services on the San Juan de la Libertad-Tarma route.  According to what he says, he does very well.  “It’s more tranquil,” he affirms. He also wants to take potato seed to the city of Arequipa (on the coast) where he has good buyers.  

He is a member of the “Unión por el Trabajo” (Unity for Work) communal bank and this is the fifth loan with MFP where he is happy because once again they are providing him with help to have the capital his work requires.  Besides, he will continue to work in his association together with his fellow group members.

Eugenio will plant the “Yungay” variety of potatoes so has asked for a loan to buy 10 sacks of organic manure (yard guano) that he’ll use to insure good growth of this next planting.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of organic manure and barnyar fowl guano.

loans.name: Bismark Jose

texts.es: Bismark José se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Vive con su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad. Inicio este negocio, porque el siempre está buscando la manera de obtener ingresos para su hogar. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de bananos, sandias, melones, mangos, naranjas y piña. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la mercadería y tener mayor capacidad para ofrecer a sus clientes. Su objetivo a futuro es tener un negocio auto sostenible, que su familia este en mejores condiciones económicas y sus hijos puedan superarse.
texts.en: Bismark Jose has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  He lives with his wife and 2 young children.  He started this business because he was always looking for a way to obtain income for his household.  At this time he requests a loan to buy bananas, watermelons, melons, mangoes, oranges and pineapples.  This investment will help him to increase his merchandise and have a better supply of products to offer to his customers.  His goal for the future is to have a self-sustaining business, so that his family can be in better financial condition and so that his children can do well in life.

loans.use: to buy bananas, watermelons, melons, mangoes, oranges and pineapples

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, tiene 38 años, y toda su vida transcurre alrededor de constante esfuerzo, ella, está casada con Fidmer, de 33 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos, peor sólo vive con uno de ellos, en sus casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Desde muy pequeña trabaja en la chacra, porque sus padres fueron grandes agricultores que le enseñaron todas las técnicas agrícolas que ahora Rosario, emplea en busca de cosechas exitosas, pero lleva 15 años cultivando papa de manera independiente, junto a su esposo. Ella, ama la tierra que la vio nacer y desde siempre sembró grandes extensiones de tubérculos (papa), porque la zona donde vive es alta, y es lo único que produce mejor, porque la calidad de la tierra es ideal, lo que más le gusta es cultivar los surcos para dejarlos alineados, porque pueden desarrollarse libremente y crecer fuertes, sin embargo le desagrada cargar los pesados sacos y trasladarlos a los mercados; por eso buscan compradores directos. En busca de nuevos ingresos económicos, quiere contar con un puesto de venta en el mercado de la ciudad “Huasahuasi” para comercializar verduras y sus sabrosas variedades de papa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Unión por el trabajo”, y este es el décimo crédito con MFP, donde está contenta de trabajar con esta asociación; pues antes pertenecía a otro grupo de personas muy trabajadoras, pero por motivo de la ubicación se tuvo que retirar. Rosario, comprará con el dinero solicitado 12 sacos de semilla de papa de la variedad “yungay”, que piensa sembrar dentro de este mes, asimismo varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Rosario is 38 years old and her entire life revolves around constant effort.  She is married to Fidmer, 33, and they have three children but only one of them lives with her in her own house located in the hamlet of Cayan.  

She has worked in the field since she was a little girl because her parents were great farmers who taught her all the farming techniques that Rosario now uses in search of successful harvests.  However, she’s been farming independently alongside her husband for 15 years now.  She loves the land of her birth and has always planted large extensions of tubers (potatoes) because the area where she lives is at a high elevation and that’s the only thing that grows well because the quality of the land is ideal and they can develop freely and grow strong.  However, she doesn’t like having to carry the heavy sacks to market and this is why they seek out direct buyers. In search of new sources of income she wants to have a stand in the city of “Huasahuasi” to sell vegetables and her delicious varieties of potato.

She is a member of the “Unión por el Trabajo” (Unity for Work) communal bank and this is the tenth loan.  She is happy to work with this association because she used to belong to a different group of very hard working people but because of its location she had to drop out.

Rosario will use the requested money to buy 12 sacks of potato seed of the “Yungay” variety that she plans to plant this month as well as several sacks of organic manure to spread among her plants.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of potato seed and sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: María Moncerrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene 51 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, el menor de ellos que es soltero vive con ella. Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco ella empezó su negocio que le ha traído muchas satisfacciones.

Es una gran mujer que se dedica a lavar ropa ajena y en sus ratos libres se dedica  al comercio,  vende productos de Avon, Lebel, Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días tanto en sus lavados de ropa como en sus ventas, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedido, ella aprovecha para visitar a sus clientes en las noches después de que ellos salen de sus trabajos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lleva dos años que se dedica a esta actividad comercial.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería.

Sus sueños son tener buena salud y fuerzas para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Union y Solidaridad" meets twice a month in the San Pablo parish of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabi, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

Here we meet Maria, 51, who is a single mother with 3 grown children.  The youngest of these is single and lives with her.  She has been in her communal bank for 4 years, and she likes it because with one of the loans she received from the bank she started her own business, which has brought her a lot of satisfaction.

She is a great woman who works outside the house washing clothes, and in her free time she has a business selling products from the Avon, Lebel, and Yanbal line (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories.)  Every day she works washing clothing and also goes door-to-door to take orders for her beauty products. She takes the opportunity to visit with her customers in the evenings after they have returned home from work. She sells her products on credit and collects every week. She tells us that she has been selling beauty products for 2 years.

She will use this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry.

Her dream is to have good health, and the strength to carry on.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and jewelry

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 40 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedica a la agricultura ya que sus padres le enseñaron todo lo referente a la agricultura y es así que en la actualidad se ha convertido en una fuente muy importante de ingresos para su familia. Cada día trabaja en compañía de su esposo, en donde vigilan sus terrenos de cultivo, procurar fertilizarlos para mejorar su producción anterior. Su fin es ganar dinero lo suficiente para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa y ampliar sus terrenos para sembrar mayor variedad de productos entre tubérculos y cereales, por lo que se propone en ahorrar y planificar sus compras. Es su segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y  considera que ha tenido una experiencia exitosa el haber accedido a un crédito que le permite crecer en su actividad económica de la cual esta muy agradecida,  se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Eusebia, 40, lives with her husband and two children in her own house.  Since childhood she’s farmed because her parents taught her everything related to agriculture and it’s now become a very important source of family income.  She works daily accompanied by her husband watching over their fields attempting to better fertilize them to improve on their previous production.  Her goal is to earn sufficient money to improve her house’s infrastructure and to expand her fields to plant a larger variety of products including tubers and cereals.  She, therefore, plans to save and plan her purchases.

This is her second loan with MFP and she considers that she’s had a successful experience having accessed a loan that makes it possible for her to grow in her economic activity for which she is very grateful and committed to be punctual with her payments.

She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime es un hombre soltero de 32 años de edad, vive en la casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de agua y luz. Su casa está ubicada en el caserío Alfredo Vilca  Aguilar a unos 15 minutos de  Tambogrande  y a 30 minutos del  departamento de  Piura.  Esta zona rural se dedica ha la actividad agricola,  ganadera y turismo.

Jaime se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas), cubriendo la ruta que va desde su caserío a Tambogrande y visceversa .  Jaime tiene su propia clientela e incluso lo contratan para llevar a niños en edad escolar por lo mismo que vive en el mismo lugar, ésto le permite tener mayores ingresos para poder ayudar  de algún modo a sus padres a solventar los gastos diarios. Otra actividad que realiza es la crianza de animales.

A solicitado un préstamo ha Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, ya que lo utiliza diariamente mañana y tarde y por ser un camino accidentado necesita realizar algunos cambios de respuestos, permitiendole garantizar un mejor servicio y obtenga a largo plazo mejores ingresos.

Jaime es muy cocnocido en el caserío Alfredo Vilca Aguilar por ser un joven de confianza, muy respetuoso y responsable con su clientes que utilizan sus transporte, con el objetivo de seguir mejorando en la vida.
texts.en:
Jaime, 32, is single living in his parents’ house which only has electricity and water.  His house is located in the Alfredo Vilca Aguilar hamlet about 15 minutes from Tambogrande and 30 minutes from Piura Department.  This rural area is devoted to farming, raising cattle and tourism.

Jaime drives a mototaxi (transportation vehicle used by people for short routes) covering the route that goes from his hamlet to Tambogrande and vice versa.  Jaime has his own established clientele that even hire him to take their children to school because he lives in the same place as them.  This allows him to have higher income to somehow help his parents meet daily expenses.  Another activity he undertakes is raising animals.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to service his mototaxi because he uses it daily morning and afternoon.  Because the roads are in poor shape he needs to replace some parts to guarantee better service and continue earning income in the long run.

Jaime is very well known in Alfredo Vilca Aguilar hamlet for being a trustworthy, very respectful and responsible young man toward the customers who use his transport with the goal of continuing to improve his life.

loans.use: to service his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Nora Bertha

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado D. Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia D. Calca, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Nora, ella tiene 61 años D. edad y es casada, la socia tiene 7 hijos y todos ellos a la fecha D. hoy están independientes, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la compra y venta D. especería (comino, ajo molido, pimienta, ajo seco, ají molido y todo lo referente a condimentos para aderezar los alimentos). La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra D. especies para incrementar su mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. especies para su negocio.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá D. manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Nora, 61, is a member of the “PRO DESARROLLO” (Pro Development) communal bank located in the town of Pisac which belongs to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has 7 children all of whom are independent to date.  She alternates her daily household chores with running a spice shop (cumin, ground garlic, pepper, dry garlic, ground chili pepper and everything related to condiments used to spice up food).  She wants the loan to buy spices to increase her stock merchandise.  She is asking for the loan to buy spices for her business.

She is grateful and wants to express that she’ll be very disciplined regarding making her payments.

loans.use: to buy spices.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Desde su niñez aprendió el valor del trabajo en el campo, desde entonces trabaja todos los días  desde muy temprano por la madrugada para ver sus cultivos. Principalmente cultiva papa, maíz, oca, entre otros productos. Siempre procura que la plaga de insectos no perjudique sus plantaciones, asimismo los fertiliza cada cierto tiempo para fortalecerlos. Luego de varios meses de espera puede ver recién los frutos de su arduo trabajo, que al ser vendidos, las ganancias le ayudan a cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Parte de este trabajo, considera que el cambio de clima perjudica sus plantaciones, por otro lado el bajo precio que se ofrece de este producto en el mercado le molesta ya que no puede recuperar lo invertido. Aún así ha salido adelante optando por otros productos mas rentables como el trigo y el maíz,  es por eso que ha decidió mejorar sus cultivos y sembrar para en sus variedades así como habas, por ser productos más rentables. Es su crédito número 7 que tiene con MFP,  considera que trabajar en su banco comunal es una buena experiencia que le permite mejorar en el aspecto económico por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semillas para su siembra de papa y maíz.
texts.en:
Flora, 44, lives with her husband and son in her own house.  Since childhood she learned the value of working the land.  Since then she’s worked every day from very early at dawn on her crops.  She grows mainly potato, corn and oca (a tuber), among other products.  She always tries to keep insect infestations from damaging her crops as well as fertilizing every so often to strengthen them.  After a period of several months of waiting she can begin to see the fruits of her hard labor which, upon sale, produce profits that help her meet household needs.

On one hand she feels that changes in the weather damage her plants and on the other hand the low market prices for these products bother her because she’s unable to recuperate her investment.  Even so, she’s gotten ahead by opting for other, more profitable crops, like wheat and corn. Because of this she’s decided to improve her crops planting more variety, like lima beans, because they are more profitable products.

This is loan #7 with MFP.  She considers that working with a communal bank is a good experience that allows her to improve her economic situation so she commits to be very punctual with her repayments.  She will use the loan to buy sacks of manure and seed for her potato and corn planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and potato and corn seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Ronald Froilan

texts.es:
Ronald es un hombre soltero de 21 años, vive en  casa de sus padres, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío Huaca Partida, el cual se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del distrito de Pítipo y a unos 30 minutos aproximadamente del departamento de Lambayeque.  Lugar donde se desarrolla  la actividad agricola   y  la crianza de animales.

Ronald se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas,pavos y patos) desde hace unos 2 años, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa,  su negocio lo realiza en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo los días martes y viernes donde hay mayor cantidad de clientela y así pueda vender más rápido sus animales.  Con esos ingresos pude ayudar  a  sus padres a cubrir las  necesidades diarias.

El crédito solicitado por Ronalda a Edpyme Alternativa es de 800 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para su aves de corral  y seguir negociandolo en los diferentes mercados de la zona. Una vez que haya realizado las  ventas de sus aves de corral podrá pagar su préstamo como tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y sus padres.

Ronald es un hijo muy responsable y trabajador por eso dedica todo su tiempo en tratar de ayudar a sus padres con la finalidad de que ellos se sientan bien.
texts.en: Ronald is a 21-year-old single man and lives in his parents' home, which has water and electric services. It is located in the village of Huaca Partida, about 15 minutes from the district of Pítipo and approximately 30 minutes from the department of Lambayeque. It is here where Ronald makes a living in agriculture and livestock, buying, raising and selling poultry (chickens, turkeys and ducks) for the past two years. His farmyard is in the back of the house, and he makes his sales at the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo on Tuesdays and Fridays, when there is a larger number of customers and he can sell his animals more quickly. With the income, he has helped his parents cover necessary daily expenses. Ronald is requesting a loan of 800 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to purchase balanced feed for his birds and to continue doing business at the different markets in the area. Once he has sold his birds he will be able to repay they loan, and he and his parents will have a better quality of life. Ronald is a very responsible and hard-working son, which is why he dedicates all his time to trying to help his parents and make them feel good.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his poultry.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ceferina, la socia tiene 38 años de edad; la socia es conviviente, ella tiene 4 hijos de 20, 17, 15, 12, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía ella trabaja de forma independiente y requiere el préstamo para poder implementar su negocio la socia elabora parte de la artesanía que vende como bisutería, trabajos en lana, como guantes, chalinas, mantillas y la otra mitad que es ceniceros, floreros, vasos y todo lo referente a arcilla y pinturas ella compra hecho. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de artesanía. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Ceferina belongs to the "Pro Desarrollo" community bank located in the town of Pisac, province of Calca, department of Cusco. She is 38 years old, married and has four children, ages 20, 17, 15 and 12. She alternates her household responsibilities with her crafts business, where she works independently. She is requesting the loan to set up her business. She makes handicrafts to sell, partially jewelry and wool items like gloves, scarves, and handkerchiefs, and the other part ashtrays, vases and glasses. She buys all the clay crafts and paintings she sells. Ceferina is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of handicrafts. She is grateful and wishes to express that she will make her payments with discipline.

loans.use: to purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Luisa, ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada, la socia tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades principales con el comercio minorista la socia compra y vende emoliente, ella compra al por mayor, linaza, cebada y otras especies que son consideradas como hierbas saludables, una vez que los hierve ella hace la infusión y lleva en un carrito preparado para la ocasión a vender, la socia vende a partir de las 6 de la tarde en la esquina de su barrio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de hierbas y especies. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Luisa belongs to the "Pro Desarrollo" community bank in the town of Pisac, province of Calca, department of Cusco. She is 36 years old, married and has two children, ages 13 and 11. She alternates her work as a retailer buying and selling emollients and as spice merchant. She purchases flaxseed, barley and other healthy herbs and spices wholesale. Once she boils and infuses them, she puts them in a cart set up to sell the items. She works after 6 p.m. at a corner in her neighborhood. Luisa is requesting the loan to purchase more herbs and spices. She is grateful and wishes to express that she will be disciplined in repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase herbs and spices.

loans.name: Gregoria Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Gregoria, ella es madre soltera de tres hijos uno mayor de edad  y dos de 9 y 6 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos  y sin tantos requisitos.

Ella es una gran madre que para que a sus hijos no les falte nada se dedica al comercio, vende ropa interior tanto para hombres como para mujeres,  pero agrega que lo que más vende son interiores de hombres. Trabaja  todos los días en la  terminal terrestre desde las 8 h00 hasta las 14h00 en algunos días  ya que en las tardes tiene que ir a ayudar a sus hijos en las tares de escuela. Su mercadería las compra en Picoaza, nos cuenta que lleva seis años en esta actividad y que esto le ha servido para sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior para su negocio, en especial camisetas interiores que sus clientes le piden mucho.
 
Su sueño es tener un local con vitrinas y bien surtido.
texts.en:
The “3 de Mayo” (May 3) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place known for being very commercial, for its festival of Sts. Peter and Paul and for the joyfulness of its residents.

We met Gregoria here.  He’s a single mother of three children, one adult and two who are 9 and 6 years of age and go to school.  She’s been in the communal bank for 6 years and likes it because the loans are quick and don’t have a lot of requirements.

She is a great mother who, in order that her children lack nothing, is in business.  She sells underwear for both men and women but she adds that what she sells the most is men’s underwear.  She works every day at the bus terminal from 8am until 2pm on some of the days because in the afternoon she has to go help her children with their homework.  She buys her merchandise in Picoaza and she tells us that she’s been in this business for 6 years and she has availed herself of it to support her children.

She will use this loan to buy underwear for her business, especially undershirts which have high customer demand.  Her dream is to have a locale with well stocked display cases.

loans.use: to buy underwear, especially t-shirts.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: Alba Luz se dedica a la venta de quesillos. Tiene más de veinte años en este negocio, con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha salido adelante. Alba sale todas las mañanas a vender su producto, por lo que se siente contenta de obtener un medio de ingreso para su familia. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de crema, queso, tortillas entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en:
Alba Luz sells quesillo (a type of cheese).  She’s been in the business for over twenty years.  With much effort and sacrifice she’s gotten ahead.  Alba goes out every morning to sell her product and feels happy to have a means of earning family income.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy cream, cheese and tortillas among other necessary products.

loans.use: to buy cream, cheese and tortillas.

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Ceferina, ella tiene 57 años de edad, la socia es soltera y tiene 4 hijos de 38, 37, 36, 15 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su restaurante, la socia tiene un restaurante el cual ella misma se encarga de los alimentos y de todo lo referente a la buena disposición del local, la socia siempre invierte su dinero de los bancos comunales en la mejora de cubiertos, remplazo de vajillas, y en la compra de ingredientes y productos al por mayor para que le salga a cuenta, la socia desea comprar algunos servicios como vajilla y sal, aceite, fideos, arroz al por mayor, la socia también se encarga de vender caldo de gallina y extras en especial los días feriados y domingos. La socia solicita el préstamo en la compra de servicios para el restaurante y mercadería.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” (Pro Development) and is located in the town of Pisac which belongs to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Ceferina, 57.  She’s single and has four children who are 38, 37, 36 and 15 years of age.  She alternates her household chores with running a restaurant.  She has a restaurant that where she, herself, is in charge of cooking the meals and of everything related to the good running of the establishment.  She always invests her money from the communal banks to improve her eating utensils, to replace dinnerware and to buy ingredients and products at wholesale so that she can afford them.

She wants to buy dinnerware, salt, oil, noodles and rice at wholesale.  She also sells chicken soup and extras especially during feast days and Sundays.  She is asking for the loan to buy eating utensils and merchandise for the restaurant.

She is grateful and wants to express that she will meet her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy dinnerwear and merchandise for the restaurant.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Augusto, el socio tiene 42 años y aunque en su D.N.I; diga que el tiene el estado civil como soltero él dice que es conviviente, el socio es pareja de la socia Luisa y juntos tienen 2 hijos de 13 y 11 años de edad; el socio trabaja prestando el servicio de transporte, el traslada carga pesada con su camión y alquila su camión a todo aquel que lleve carga pesada para la construcción u otros; el socio desea en esta ocasión renovar un par de llantas para su camión y es por eso que el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de llantas.

El socio se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called “PRO DESARROLLO” (Pro Development) and is located in the town of Pisac which belongs to Calca Province, Cusco Department.

The member is Augusto, 42, and even though his D.N.I. (National Identity Document) says his marital status is single, he says that he lives with his partner.  He is the life partner of the member, Luisa, and they have two children together who are 13 and 11 years of age.

He works providing transportation services.  He transports heavy cargo in his truck and also leases his truck to whoever needs to transport heavy loads for construction or others.  On this occasion, he wants to replace a pair of tires on his truck and this is why he is asking for a loan: to buy tires.

He is grateful and wishes to express that he will pay his installments in a disciplines way.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Faatalatala

texts.en:
Faatalatala is 32 years of age, married with two children. Faatalatala is in the business of planting & harvesting bananas for sale.  She has 3 years experience in this business. Faatalatala needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 120 talas or US $50 per week) to improve the business.

Faatalatala joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Faatalatala's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro es una señora D. 60 años D. edad que vive con su hija y su yerno en una comunidad granD. en el distrito D. Patapo, departamento D. Lambayeque. Socorro es muy estimada en su comunidad, una comunidad urbana donD. la actividad predominante es la crianza D. animales y a pesar D. sus años Socorro  se dedica a eso.

Socorro cría cerdos desD. hace 15 años, en un corralón que es D. su propiedad y está hecho D. quincha. La quincha es una especie D. tejido D. tallos muy delgados (similares a los tallos D. bambú) que están pegados con barro. 

Socorro solicita un préstamo D. 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para levantar paredes D. adobe (material más resistente, hecho D. arcilla) en su corralón. Esto les brindará una mejor crianza a sus animales y contribuirá al crecimiento D. su negocio que se ha ido desarrollando D. manera positiva con el paso del tiempo.

Socorro  se siente segura D. que su negocio se beneficiará con ello, pues la raza D. sus cerdos es muy buena. 

Socorro  ha sido clienta D. Edpyme Alternativa y goza D. buenas referencias por cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Socorro is a 60-year-old woman who lives with her daughter and son-in-law in a large community in the district of Patapo, in the department of Lambayeque. Socorros is held in high esteem by her community, an urban area where the main economic activity is raising animals. In spite of her age, this is what Socorro does for a living.

Socorro has raised pigs for 15 years in a large patio on her property maD. of quincha. Quincha is a type of thin reed (similar to bamboo reeds) that are stuck together with mud. 

Socorro is asking for a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to put up mud walls (more sturdy materials, maD. of clay) in her corral. This will help her to raise her animals better and will contribute to the expansion of her business that has been developing positively over time.Socorro feels sure that her business will benefit from this, since her pigs are from a good breed. 

Socorro has been a client of Edpyme Alternativa and has good references for making her payments on time.

loans.use: Construir corral para sus cerdos.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, que vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa, no tiene casa propia, vive con sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Olmos a unos 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Olmos se caracteriza por se una zona agrícola, ganadera y comercial.

José  desde hace algún tiempo es trabajador  independiente en el área de construcción, es decir,  lo contratan  por temporadas y el ingreso que le dan es diario, lo que le permite solventar algunos gastos del hogar.  Pero hace un unos 2 meses atrás recien lo ha contratado una empresa constructor,lo que le permitiría mejorar más la calidad de vida de su familia.

A solicitado José a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  500 nuevos soles  para comprar los útiles esolares para sus hijos que le han solicitado en el colegio.  Con sus nuevos ingresos podrá cubrir el  préstamo como cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar.

José es un padre y esposo  muy responsable, trabajador, con el objetivo principal  de que sus hijos tengan un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Jose is a 30-year-old father who lives with his three children and his wife. They do not have their own home, but live in his parents' house which is located in the district of Olmos about 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Olmos is a region of agriculture, cattle and commerce.

Jose has worked for some time as an independent construction worker; that is, he is contracted seasonally and is paid daily, which allows him to cover some of the costs of the home. But 2 months ago a construction company hired him, which will allow him to improve his family's quality of life.

Jose has asked Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy school supplies that the schools have required of his kids. With his new income he will be able to repay the loan and cover the costs of the home.

Jose is a very responsible father and husband, hardworking, with the main goal of providing his kids with a better future.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his kids.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ana, tiene 54 años de edad, en la actualidad está separada pero de esa relación tuvo tres hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive un nieto de doce años que desde que nació vive con ella, el mismo que estudia en colegio.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual venden  todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, carne, pollo, pescado, etc.    Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y veces hasta más tarde, los productos los compra en Portoviejo ya que allá le salen más baratos y algunos los  recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 20 años con su negocio.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 10 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le han servido de mucho para ayudar a sus hijos.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo (May 3) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the joy of its people.

We met Ana, 54, here.  She is currently separated but she had three children, all adult and independent now, from her relationship.  She lives with her 12 year old grandson who has lived with her since birth; he is going to school.

She has a home based grocery store where she sells all types of products like: rice, sugar, oil, detergent, meat, chicken, fish, etc.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  She buys her products in Portoviejo because they are less expensive there and some of her stock is delivered to her.  She’s been in business over 20 years.

She is going to use this loan to stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats and other basic need items. 

She’s been in the communal bank for 10 years and she likes it because the loans have been very useful for her to help her children.

Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more each day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: María Marisel

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María,  tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años los mismos que  estudian en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 6 años y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y se entretiene mucho en las reuniones.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual venden todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. También vende artículos para el hogar, para lo cual visita  a sus clientes dos veces por semana aunque también los vende en su local. Los productos de la tienda los recibe en su local y los artículos para el hogar los compra en Portoviejo en una distribuidora. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 10 años con su tienda y que ha crecido poco a poco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda con productos de primera necesidad y artículos para el hogar.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The 3 de Mayo (May 3) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo’s Picoaza Parish, a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast day of Saints Peter and Paul and for the joy of its people.

We met María, 42, here.  She’s married and has two children who are 10 and 7 years of age and going to school.  Her husband is an Auto Mechanic.  She’s been in the communal bank for 6 years and likes it because her fellow members are very united and she entertains herself a lot in the meetings.

She has a home based grocery store where she sells all types of products like: rice, sugar, oil, detergents, among other things.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm and sometimes even later.  She also sells items for the home.  For this she visits her customers twice a week although he also sells them in her store.  Merchandise for the store is delivered to her there and the articles for the home she buys in Portoviejo from a distributor.  She tells us that she’s had her store for over ten years and that it has gradually grown.

She is going to use this loan to better stock her store with basic use items and items for the home.  Her goals are to stay in business and that her store grows more each day.

loans.use: to buy basic need items and items for the home.

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio es un joven de 19 años de edad, él es soltero, no tiene carga familiar directa, vive con sus padres. Vive en el  P.J  Vista Hermosa, cuenta con los servicios básicos (agua y energía eléctrica); esta ubicada  en el distrito de Pimentel, primer balneario del norte del Perú.

Braulio, cuenta con una unidad vehicular (mototaxi, vehiculo de transporte público, con  moto y una cabina para el transporte de personas), que es de su propiedad, con la cual  brinda servicio  de transporte publico de pasajeros. Además se desempeña como estibador (cargador), en el mercado mayorista de Mochoqueque, Braulio es un joven que tiene experiencia en el rubro, pues tiene bastante tiempo desempeñando esta labor.  

Braulio necesita este crédito que esta solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa de
 S/, 1000,00 para que el pueda adquirir ventanas de fierro y una puerta para su vivienda, así apoyar a sus padres de esta manera contribuir a la seguridad de su hogar pues que es donde por las noches guarda su mototaxi, herramienta principal de su trabajo.                  

 Braulio, es un cliente nuevo, para Edpyme Alternativa pero cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Braulio is a 19 year-old youth who is single and has no family responsibilities.  He lives with his parents in P.J. Vista Hermosa.  Their house has basic utilities (water and electric), and is located in the Pimentel district, the first seaside resort in the north of Peru.

Braulio has a vehicle (a mototaxi, which is a motorcycle with an attached cabin used for public transportation) that is his own property.  He uses it to provide passenger transportation services.  In addition, he provides cargo transportation to the wholesale market of Mochoqueque.  Braulio is a young person who has experience in this line of work, as he has been doing this type of work for some time now.

Braulio needs the loan that he is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles so that he can buy iron window grills and a door for his home.  In this way he can contribute to his household by making his parents' house more secure.  In addition, this is where he parks his mototaxi for the night, the main tool of his work.

Braulio is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa, but he has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy steel security bars for the windows and doors of his house

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is from the city of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 41 years old and married with eight adult children. To make a living, Josephine operates a transportation business. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle for better service

loans.name: Hilda Noemy

texts.es:
Noemy tiene 27 años de edad. Vive con su esposo en casa de sus padres, residen en una zona urbana de José Leonardo Ortiz uno de los mas grandes de la provincia de Chiclayo y cuenta con los servicios básicos (energía eléctrica y agua). 

Noemy  se dedica a la venta de comidas, refrescos y chupetes. Ella se encarga de  preparar alimentos según como vallan cambiando las temporadas del año, estos alimentos los vende en la puerta de su casa desde hace más de 1 año y cuenta con clientela fija que diariamente acuden a su negocio.  

Noemy esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de S/. 500.00 para destinarlo a la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas y refrescos, de esta manera abastecer aun público más grande con más variedad de comidas y bebidas para que estos estén a gusto con sus servicio. 
 
Noemy es una mujer con grandes aspiraciones y cuenta con buenas referencias gracias a su muestra de trabajo y empeño.
texts.en:
Noemy is 27 years old.  She lives with her husband in her parent's house, in the urban Jose Leonardo Ortiz neighborhood, one of the biggest in the Chiclayo province.  Their home has basic utility services (electricity and water.)

Noemy has a business selling food, soft drinks and popsicles.  She prepares different food items according to the season, and sells this food from a door in her house.  She has had this business for more than a year, and now has regular customers who turn up each day at her business.

Noemy  is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 500 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy supplies to make food and drinks.  In this way she can sell to even more customers and have a greater variety of food and drinks to sell so that her customers will be pleased with her service.  

Noemy is a woman with great aspirations, and she has good references thanks to her demonstrated hard work and determination.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food for her business

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 42 años de edad. El es casado y vive con su esposa y sus dos menores hijos. Ellos tienen una casa propia y está situada en un caserío “cruce de vega” en el distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de  Piura en el norte de Perú. Javier vive en la parte rural de esta localidad, pero aun así cuenta con servicio de luz.

Javier se dedica  a la agricultura. Esta actividad es el sustento de su hogar, para la que cuenta con un área de 2.00 hectáres, en la cual tiene 1.50 hectáres  de Mango en producción, dicha plantación tiene 8 años de edad y 0.50 has de limón en producción el cual lo cosecha semanalmente.  Complementariamente  Javier trabaja en un fundo agrícola el cual le genera ingresos adicionales. Cuenta con una experiencia de 5 años en el rubro de producción.

Para cada uno de los  productos de Javier, existe  un mercado fijo permanente, pues cuenta con clientes que esta muy contentos con los productos que Javier ofrece.

Javier solicita un crédito de  S/. 3,000.00 a Edpyme Alternativa para realizar las labores culturales de aplicación de fertilizante y agroquímicos. De esta manera se logrará una cosecha de buena calidad en el tiempo oportuno  y la cantidad que le soliciten, así crecer como empresario y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, a su familia.
 
Javier, es un cliente nuevo de Edpyme Alternativa, Javier sino ha manejado créditos con otro banco y presenta muy buen historial crediticio, lo cual da fe de su responsabilidad puntualidad y trabajo.
texts.en:
Javier is 42 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two young children. They own a home in the village of Cruce de Vega in the District of Tambogrande, Department of Piura, in northern Peru. Even though Javier lives in the rural section of the community, he still receives electricity.

He works as a farmer in order to support his household. Javier has two hectares of land of which one and a half hectares are devoted to mango production. He has been growing this crop for eight years. The remaining half hectare is devoted to producing lemons which are harvested each week. In addition, Javier works at a farming cooperative to generate additional income. He has five years of experience as a farmer.

Each of his products has an established market. He has customers who are very happy with the goods that he offers. Javier is requesting a loan of 3000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can complete farm tasks, such as applying fertilizers and chemicals. He hopes to achieve a good-quality harvest at the right time and in the appropriate amounts. Javier hopes to grow as an entrepreneur and provide his family a better quality of life.

He is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa. Javier has managed loans with another bank, so he presents a good credit history that indicates that he is responsible, prompt, and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Alvidio

texts.es:
Aldivio tiene 43 años de edad.  El es casado y tiene  tres  hijos. Vive en casa propia y que está ubicada en en el distrito de Tambogrande en Piura. Alvidio  vive a  solo 30 Kms del centro del distrito en la zona rural y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Alvidio se desenvuelve en la actividad agrícola.  Él desarrolla esta labor hace más de 10 años, entre sus principales productos tenemos el mango y el limón; el terreno es de su madre pero él la ayuda con su administración y cuidados del mismo.

 Alvidio solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  por la suma de S/. 3000.00,  para la compra de insumos y demás fertilizantes para su cultivo, logrando de esta manera una mejor producción, también lo necesita para poda del cultivo de mango.  Gracias a este crédito el podrá distribuirlos y venderlos en su localidad como en diferentes distritos  de al ciudad de Piura.

Alvidio tiene el deseo de darle  tanto a su a su madre como a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, objetivo por el que lucha día a día y al que pretende llegar gracias al crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Alvidio is 43 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in his own home located in the District of Tambogrande in Piura, which is only 30 kilometers from the central part of this rural district. Alvidio does not receive basic services.

He earns his living as a farmer and has been in this line of work for more than ten years. Among the main crops he produces are mangos and lemons. Even though the land is owned by his mother, Alvidio helps to manage and take care of it.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 PEN in order to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops. This will enable him to achieve better production. He also needs to prune his mango trees. Thanks to this loan, Alvidio will be able to distribute and sell in his community as well as in different districts within the city of Piura.

Alvidio wants very much to provide his mother and his family a better quality of life. For this reason, he strives day after day to achieve growth in his business.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Tsedendash

texts.en:
Tsedendash E., 24 years old, is a student who lives with his parents in Mongolia’s Tuv province. His parents’ monthly income is 750,000 MNT. Tsedendash goes to Health Sciences University of Mongolia and is majoring in pharmaceutical studies. He is now taking three courses and will graduate from university in May, 2012. 

Tsedendash is requesting a loan of 328,000 MNT to pay his tuition fees. He is a proud man who says, "I will graduate from my university successfully and will lift a hand for the evolution of our country.”

loans.use: To pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida G. is 54 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the village of Tabid, a part of Ozamiz City. Bienvenida runs a motor transport service. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Bienvenida joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, her first from GDMPC, which will be used to repair her motorbike’s existing engine. Bienvenida plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing motorbike engine.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn A. is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Pantaon, a part of Ozamiz City. Madelyn is a farmer who plants and harvests cassava for sale. She has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Madelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Madelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, her first from GDMPC, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann Z. is from the city of Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is 25 years old. Mary Ann is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be Mary Ann's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Merenciana

texts.en:
Merenciana S. is from the city of Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is 60 years old. Merenciana is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Merenciana raises crops, planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Merenciana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Merenciana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Merenciana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure and to pay for the labor cost of farm maintenance. This loan will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor cost

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P. is from the city of Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old. Norma is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting gabi for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Elizabeth

Elizabeth P. is from the city of Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Elizabeth is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle A. is from the city of Pantaon Ozamiz City. She is 25 years old. Michelle is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Michelle owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting gabi for sale. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Michelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:
