loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
The woman in this photograph is Mao S..  She is 24 years old and lives in the province of Kompong Cham, which is the best territory for farming.  Mao S. is a married woman who is devoted to her two young children who are attending school and who depend on her care. 

Mao S. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother and grows various crops on it.  She also has another farm that she owns, but she is not planting crops on it yet. She hopes to use her Kiva loan to hire a machine to plow her farmland and to purchase bean seeds, insecticides and fertilizer to grow crops.

loans.use: to pay for plowing & buy bean seeds, insecticides & fertilizer

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is from the village of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old, married, and has ten adult children. To make a living, she runs a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks in the local community.   Andresa has been engaged in her business for nine years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities. 

Andresa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry S. is from the village of Sebasi Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 47 years old. Jerry is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Jerry has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jerry joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC.  Jerry is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his fourth loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Gongob

texts.en:
H. is from the village of Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, H. runs a business making and selling furniture in the local community.   She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities. 

H. joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to pay for materials needed to make bamboo furniture. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buy materials to make bamboo furniture

loans.name: Batchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Batchimeg is 27 years old.  She lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. In 2000, her parents started a family business selling furniture.  Mrs. Batchimeg used to sell furniture at the Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. Then in 2006 she started her own furniture selling business along with her husband. 

Mrs. Batchimeg buys brand new furniture from China at wholesale price, transports them to Ulaanbaatar city and resells them. She also buys second-hand furniture from private households, refurbishes them and sells them to her customers.  From her earnings, she has managed to buy a plot of land and a small truck to transport her goods. In the future, she is planning to build a family house on her land. Therefore, she needs to increase her business profit.   

Recently, Mrs. Batchimeg has rented another stall to sell her products. The loan she is taking out will be used to buy more furniture to sell and to buy a metal container to store her products during night time.

loans.use: buy more furniture to sell and a metal container for storage

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a Buko Juice Vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her sari-sari store.  Yolanda is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of buko for her Buko Juice Vending business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her buko juice vending.

loans.use: To buy more buko for buko juice making

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Chin H. is a 32-year-old woman who is married to Sat Seit, age 32. They both are rice growers in Kompong Cham province. The couple lives with their four school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops on their own farmland.  Presently, Chin H. wants to plant a potato crop, but she doesn’t have immediate money to do tH. yet. For this reason, Chin H. has decided to seek a loan to buy a few sacks of fertilizer, potato crop, and insecticide, which she will use to protect her crop. She will also pay for the cost of plowing, which she hired out earlier.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, potato crop, and insecticide and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Consolacion works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish sales  business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her banana farm and general store.  Consolacion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her dried fish business.

Consolacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 54 years old and married with five children. Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Teresita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 13 years and also earns income from pig raising.

Teresita aspires to save and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 47 years old and married with two children. Elvira works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, cooking oil, etc. 

Elvira has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, sugar, "Pancit", curls, etc. 

In the future Elvira would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Chhoeun

texts.en:
Chhoeun S. is a 36-year-old who sews both traditional clothes and modern clothes for her neighbors and other villagers in and around her community in Kompong Cham province. She is able to earn a daily income from this tailoring business, an average of $2 a day, to support  her family. 

Chhoeun S. is married to Gnorb Him, 39, a cow seller, and they have two single children. In addition, she has been planting different kinds of crops as an annual activity. Chhoeun S. will be using her loan to pay for plowing as well as purchasing potato seed and bean seed for planting.

loans.use: to pay for plowing as well as purchasing potato seed and bean seed for planting.

loans.name: Evengeline

texts.en:
Evengeline is 50 years old and married with eight children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a "Nipa" (palm leaf mat used for roofing and siding) business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of palm leaves to sell.

Evengeline has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the "Nipa" (palm leaf mat) business for 20 years and also earns income from Pig Fattening.

Evengeline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of "nipa" (palm leaf mats) to sell.

loans.name: Laurita

texts.en:
Laurita is 69 years old and married with two children. Laurita works very hard to provide for them. She  buys and sells "Nipa" (palm leaves) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more palm leaves to sell.

Laurita has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future Laurita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more palm leaves to sell.

loans.name: Boeurn

texts.en:
Boeurn S. is a 37-year-old farmer and a mother. She was blessed with four kids, all of whom are attending the public school and live under her care. Her husband, Mr. Chhuon Sok, is 40 and works in the farming business. 

Boeurn S. inherited from her grandmother the farmland where she and her husband grow different kinds of crops. As Boeurn S. lacks capital to plant her crops, she made the decision to borrow from Kiva to rent the plowing machine and buy fertilizers and seed for planting. She will use the rest of the funds to dig a well for a water system.

loans.use: to rent the plowing machine and buy fertilizers and seed for planting.

loans.name: Nyamdorj

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamdorj is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in their family house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar city. The two teenage daughters attend a local secondary school. 

Nyamdorj has been running a Mongolian national shoe-making business for 13 years. He makes shoes according to customers' orders and he gets a lot of orders from clients to make shoes.  His wife helps in his business by sewing the outer parts of the shoes. These shoes are exclusively made by hand and all the parts need to be done the traditional way. 

During these 13 years, Nyamdorj managed to buy a plot of land, a family car and to build a family house on his business earnings. Last year he made an extension to the house but it isn’t complete yet. He has planned to build one more room and to use it as his shoe-making workshop. Until now he has been producing his shoes at home. The loan will be used to complete the extension to the house and move his workshop to a separate room.

loans.use: To complete the extension of his house and move his shoe-making workshop to a separate room.

loans.name: Esie

texts.en:
Esie is 46 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Esie has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from Ready-To-Wear clothing.

Esie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna works hard to support 2 children. She is married and has a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines.

Elna requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the envirofit stove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Elna is aware that, by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an Envirofit Stove

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is from the village of Burgos, Oroquieta City, Philippines. He is 61 years old, married and has eight adult children. Felipe runs a fish selling business.

He has been engaged in his business for 20 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Felipe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities.

Felipe is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP with which he will purchase more fish to sell. This will be his second loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a soft drinks business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Helen is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  buy more stock of soft drinks to sell.
Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of soft drinks to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Melodia

Melodia is 46 years old and is married with 1 child.

Melodia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock for her general store.

Melodia has already borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Melodia aspires to save enough money so that she can expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her general store

They have 3 years experience in this sector and make about US$8 profit each day to cover their family's expenses. Chhoem C. would like to ask for a loan to hire her neighbor’s land to plant potato crop and to pay plowing costs. She and her family currently live in the province of Kompong Cham.

loans.use: to hire her neighbor’s land to plant potato crop and to pay plowing costs.

Lolita requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Cookstove in order to lessen the amount of firewood she uses when cooking for her family. The cookstove will not only help her to save money but also help the environment and reduce health risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit Cookstove.

loans.name: Amy

She requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat. Amy has been in her business for six years. In the future, Amy would like to save enough money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

In the future, Dolores would like to buy another fishing boat to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for a fishing boat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jenny is 49 years old and has two children who are in school. Jenny has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jenny requested a 22,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment. Jenny has been in her business for 10 years. In the future, Jenny would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Chroeung

texts.en: Chroeung K. is a 40-year-old married woman who resides in the province of Kompong Cham. Chroeung K. is blessed with four school-aged children. She earns a living by planting various crops on her own farmland. She now plants a potato crop, which she will harvest and collect when they are mature. She always brings her items to sell in the local market. The size of her land is very small and she wishes to enlarge it in order to build a new house on it. Because of insufficient money, Chroeung K. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a plot of land that she will use to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land to build a new house.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Sarantuya is 55 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They have three children who are all grown up and live separately with their families. Mrs.Sarantuya works in Children’s Hospital as a cleaner and her husband runs a waste recycling business. Her husband Dagvadorj collects different recyclable materials and gives them to waste recycling factories for a small amount of money. The couple bought a house in 1988. The house is really run down and needs a proper refurbishment now. The loan Mrs.Sarantuya is asking for will be used to buy the necessary building materials such as cement, plaster, wood planks, paint and other materials to renovate the old house.

loans.use: to buy cement, plaster, wood planks, paint and other materials to refurbish her old house

loans.name: Pa

texts.en: Pa C. was born in 1977; she is a married woman and is blessed with four children. Three of them are students at the local public school. Her husband's name is Moun, 41, and he is a domestic farmer in Prey Chor district. She has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living. As the pig-raising business is very profitable, she has requested a loan of US$ 1100 to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale when pork is commanding the highest price. With the remainder of the funds, she will support her husband's farming business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets and to support her husband's farming business.

loans.name: Vinanua

texts.en:
Vinanua is from the village of San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Vinanua runs a rice retail business.

She has been engaged in her business for 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Vinanua joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Vinanua is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP with which she will purchase more sacks of rice for her rice retail business. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Suon S. A., aged 49, who lives in Prey Chor of Kompong Cham. She earns a living raising pigs as well as growing rice. Since 1990, she has run this business and it has provided her with income to maintain her standard of living. She is married with seven children: two of her children work in different occupations. Her husband helps her in the business. Suon S. A. will be using the loan to buy more pig-feed for her pig raising. She will use the rest of loan to grow rice and pay for plowing.

loans.use: to buy more pig-feed and to grow rice and pay plowing costs.

Ricky C. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 34 years old and is single. Ricky owns & operates a seafood  business, buying and selling fish like kitob, bangsi & bangus. He has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ricky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. Ricky is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like mackerel & sardines. This will be his 7th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

She is a widow. Her husband passed away years ago due to illness. She has a life partner in her daughter who is employed at a hotel and earns about $2 a day. She often shares her income with Lang Y.. Lang Y. will use her loan to buy a motorbike for her daughter to ride to work. This will reduce her travel expenses.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her daughter to ride to work.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She operates a general retail shop where she sells food items as well as some children's wear and plastic items such as chairs. This is her primary business which she has been doing for seven years. 

This is her third loan with KADET after her two previous loans were repaid successfully. With this loan she plans to buy wheat flour, snacks, soda and to add more plastic chairs and children's wear so as to grow the business.

She hopes to expand and grow her business to a wholesale operation.

loans.use: To increase stock and acquire new premises for her expanding business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 53 years old, married and has six children. He earns a living from his welding workshop, a business he has run for the past 24 years. His business is able to provide for his needs as well as his family’s needs.

Moses was introduced to KADET by an existing customer. He has never borrowed from other financial institutions and this is his first loan with KADET. With this loan, Moses plans to buy raw material for his welding business including metal rods, screws and iron sheets. 

He wants to see his business grow so that he can educate his remaining two children and also establish another workshop at a different location.

loans.use: To buy welding material like rods and sheets of iron

Joseph T. is 41 years old and married to Lilian Wairimu, who also contributes to the family's income. They have four children. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for a period of about nineteen years with an income of about $250 a month.

loans.name: Or

texts.en:
Or K. is 58 years old and owns a wooden kiosk in her village, Baray district of Kompong Tom province, where she sells food for people who need to have breakfast and lunch.  She typically makes around $2 of profit each day to meet what her family needs. 

Her husband is a rice farmer and he also hires his plowing machine to other farmers for a fee as well.  They are blessed with eight children, three are single, the other five are already married and two of whom are working as a primary teacher and in a garment factory. Currently, the plowing machine has often broken down while providing service.  Because of this problem, Or K. would like a loan to purchase a new plowing machine in order to continue providing the service to generate income.

loans.use: to purchase a new plowing machine in order to continue providing the plowing service.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated an open air food market business, selling from home to her neighbours and public motor vehicles drivers.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of improving her living standards in the future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour.  She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase food stock, bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil and maize flour.

texts.en:
Mrs. Long Y. lives in Kompong Tom Province and earns a low income. She and her husband have been working together in a rice-planting business since 2002. They have four children, three of whom are working. They are good parents who always try their best to earn money to feed and educate their children. 

To increase their daily income, Long Y. and her husband pick ripe fruits to sell at the busy market. Now Long Y. is applying for a Kiva loan as  capital to purchase additional fruits to sell.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren A. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and only daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a house that they bought on mortgage. His daughter studies in secondary school and his wife, Oyungerel, 34, helps in her husband’s business. 

Baasansuren is an artist. He makes different things like bags, purses, hats, paintings and souvenirs from colored sheep wool. He has been doing this for eight years. He makes items to order and also sells them in souvenir shops. His products are in good demand during tourist seasons. 

He is asking for a loan to buy sheep wool and paints to make beautiful souvenirs to sell.

loans.use: To buy sheep wool and paints to use in his souvenir-making business.

loans.name: C4710 Abashakashatsi Group

texts.en:
Vedaste (first on the left side)  is 26 years old and is married. He is the president of a group called “Abashakashatsi.” Vedaste sells various goods such as rice, sugar, bread, and biscuits. He has four years of experience, and works from 6 am until 10 pm every day. 

Vedaste and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more goods such as Irish potatoes,sweet potatoes, rice, sugar, bread, and biscuits to sell.  With their increased profits, Vedaste and the group will reinvest in their business.

loans.use: To buy more goods such as rice, sugar, bread and biscuits

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 23 years old and single, and he takes care of 3 children.  Emmanuel sells second-hand men's and children's clothes in the market.  He works from 7 am to 6 pm every weekday.  He has been in this business for 5 years and he currently employs one person to help him.

He has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more second-hand men's and children's clothes to sell.  With this loan, Emmanuel will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to save in the future.  He plans to build a house with his profit.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene B. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old. Arlene is widowed and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Arlene makes and sells snacks and other delicacies such as rice and cassava cakes in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. 

Arlene is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like flour, eggs and milk. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like flour, eggs and milk.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion V., 44, is a married woman with eight children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard- working entrepreneur. 

Concepcion buys and sells dry goods in the Philippines. Concepcion has been in this business for nine years.  

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

In the future, Concepcion would like to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has rented real estate houses for the past six years. In addition she also operates a motorcycle spare parts shop. Her major challenge in the business is seasonality. 

She dreams of expanding and constructing two more real estate houses in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she is requesting she wants to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
Renalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and also earns an income from selling dried fish. Renalyn sustains her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Renalyn is requesting a loan of 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fishing boat and purchase materials to dry fish. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and purchase materials to dry fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 26 years old and is married with one child, who is 3 years old.  Jean is a tailor and works from 6am to 9pm every day.  He has been in this business for 6 years.

Jean has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of buying a new sewing machine.  With any profits, Jean will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to save in the future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som C. I. is 47 years old. She is a local farmer who lives with her family in a wooden house in Kompong Tom province. Som is a married woman who has given birth to six children, all of whom are single. Two of her children work as sewers in a factory. Som and her husband help each other plant and harvest rice and vegetables on their own fertile land. 

Som recently completed rebuilding her house. She would like to invite her relatives and neighbors for a housewarming party, but she lacks the funds to hold this party. Therefore, she is requesting a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to have a housewarming party

loans.name: Jorande

texts.en:
Jorande I. is 39 years old and married with three school-aged children. He is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. To make a living, Jorande owns and operates a business buying and selling green and yellow bananas in the local community. Jorande has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Jorande joined HSPFI in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional green and yellow bananas to sell. This is Jorande’s first loan with HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his loan to improve and expand his business.


About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase green and yellow bananas to sell

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti, a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her husband is a policeman who contributes to his family basic needs. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, Mwanasiti has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She also owns houses which constitute her other source of income. Mwanasiti faces the major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her area of operation. She dreams of prospering and establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, cereals and wheat flour for her shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, cereals and wheat flour.

loans.name: Enkhsaikhan

texts.en:
Enkhsaikhan B., 37, is taxi driver and he has been in this business for five years. He lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His youngest child is 8 months old and his wife is looking after the baby at the moment. They are planning to build a family house next year. 

The taxi business is the only source of the family's living. Therefore, the condition of the family car, which he uses in his taxi business, is important to the family. 

Enkhsaikhan is asking for a loan to buy some spare parts and to do proper auto service to his car.

loans.use: To buy some spare parts and to do proper auto service to his family car, which he uses in his taxi business.

loans.name: Ezechiel

texts.en:
Ezechiel is 39 years old and is married with four children, plus three children he takes care of. He is a tailor. He starts his work at 7am and works until 6pm every weekday. He has been in this business for 2 years. Ezechiel currently employs two people to help him.

Ezechiel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more and new materials for his tailoring. From this, Ezechiel will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to buy a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more and new materials for his tailoring.

loans.name: Priscar

texts.en:
Priscar D. is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.
 
She operates a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and friends. She also makes natural juice for sale, which brings her another source of living. 

Priscar faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of constructing her own house in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry L. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 36 years old. Larry is married. 

To make a living, Larry provides habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat) or motorela services to local community members. Larry has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Larry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. 

Larry is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of the service. This will be the first loan taken out by Larry from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his motorcycle service.

loans.name: Beata

texts.en:
Beata is 32 years old and is single. She owns a well-organized canteen, where she sells foods such as breads, biscuits, tea, water, and juice. Her restaurant is open from 6am until 8pm every day except Saturday, and she has six years of experience. She currently employs two people to help her in her business. 

Beata has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more food and drink to sell. With any profit from this, Beata will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more foods to sell, such as breads, biscuits, tea, water, juice, etc.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, single, and lives with five family members of whom two work.

In 2006 Safaa opened his own boutique where he sells cosmetics and accessories. He has four years' experience, and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1200 loan to renovate his shop and to buy more merchandise. He is aiming to expand his business so he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate his shop and to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor S., age 46, makes a living by selling fish in the Baray market. She sells the fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier at an appropriate price. She currently earns an average of US $2 a day, and she has been running her business for over ten years. 

She is a single mother who has been divorced from her husband for years. Hor S. is the mother of four teenage children who are no longer in school. All of her children are working at various occupations, and they each contribute some of their income to help the family meet its daily expenses. 

Hor S. now uses her old bike to pick up her fish to sell. She hopes to use a motorcycle instead of her old bike, but she doesn't have enough cash to buy one. 

In order to deal with this problem, Hor S. is applying for a loan to add to her savings so that she can buy a used motorcycle for transporting her fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle for transporting her fish to sell.

loans.name: Rusomoka

texts.en:
Rusomoka is 42 years old and is married with five children, plus eight children he takes care of.  He works selling food from 7am to 9pm every day. He has been in this business for 2 years. 

Rusomoka has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy a large quantity of products such as rice, sugar, beans, etc. to sell.  With this loan, Rusomoka will be able to earn more, which will allow him to reinvest in his business, pay school fees for his children, and renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of products such as rice, sugar, beans, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo M. is from the village of Sebasi Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 48 years old. Ricardo is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Ricardo operates a motorcycle transport service. Ricardo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ricardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Ricardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Ricardo is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Ricardo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Segondalina

texts.en:
Segondalina L., from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City, is 50 years old, widowed and has three grown children. To make a living, Segondalina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, breads and beverages in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Segondalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more canned goods, snack foods and beverages, she plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages.

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Baigalmaa is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and five daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All her children, except for eldest daughter, who is married, study in secondary school. Baigalmaa has been running a shoe retail business since 2003. Once a month, she travels to Ereen, the Chinese border point city, and buys shoes and trainers at wholesale and resells them on the market. Her family lives in a house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy some shoes to resell and to fix the fences around the house.

loans.use: to buy shoes to increase her inventory and to fix the fences around the house

loans.name: Mkwalila Group

texts.en:
Maulid K. is in his late fifties and is married with children.  He has been running a general store since 2001.  He works from 7.00am to 8.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Maulid's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans increase the shop stock and bought a motorcycle.  He has paid back his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy another motorcycle for transport business. His dream is to one day own a hardware shop.

Maulid will share this loan with his loan group "Mkwalila" which has a total of 20 members.  The members of the group will hold each accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture Maulid is the middle, back row, wearing a brown T-shirt. (In the photo, there is a lady facing back, on the right side, who is not part of the Mkwalila group).

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Security Group

texts.en:
Asma Selemani, is in her early twenties and married with a four-year-old son. She has been running a video library for two years.  She works from 7.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Asma's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a plot of land, to buy householdings and also increased the library stock. She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more CDs and DVDs for her library.  Her dream is to one day have a big and international library.

Asma will share this loan with her loan group "Security"  which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Asma is 2nd from left in a red dress.

loans.use: To buy more CDs and DVDs for the video library

loans.name: Buth

texts.en:
Buth E. is a farmer residing in a rural area of Kompong Tom province. She feeds some piglets in a pigpen behind her house. Eventually, she will sell her pigs to a slaughterer in four-month cycles. Beside this work, she has also been planting rice which is her annual business. Her husband works in construction. 

Buth E. is looking for a $1100 loan as capital to buy a piece of fertile land and also purchase a pumping machine. She will use the rest of her loan funds to buy more pigs to raise. Buth E. has only one daughter and she is in the photo with Buth E. as well.

loans.use: to buy a piece of fertile land and also purchase a pumping machine.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 56 years old and is a widow with two children between 22 and 31 years old. Therese sells cloths such as: curtains in the market. Her business is well organized. Therese has nine years of experience in her business and she works from 8am until 6pm every day except on Saturday. Therese currently employs one person to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more curtains to sell. With any profits, Therese will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more curtains to sell.

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 45 years old, married and has four children.

In 2009 Hanaa opened a food market where she sells all kinds of food, beverages, and desserts. She has two years experience and a good reputation and she is well known in her area.

She is requesting a $2500 loan to buy a new refrigerator and to make more shelves for her market. She aspires to obtain more income through increased sales so she will be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new refrigerator and to make more shelves for her market.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda P. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. She is 60 years old. Melinda is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Melinda owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling firewood in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of firewood. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Melinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of firewood.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy P. is from the village of Lunotan, Gingoog City. She is 31 years old. Cristy is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Cristy owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts & green bananas in the local community. Cristy has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cristy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts & bananas. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cristy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts & bananas.

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice is 35 years old, married with 4 children.  She sells garments for women and children.  Her business is open from 8am until 8pm every day except on Saturday, and she has 7 year's experience running it. 

Mediatrice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a variety of women's and children's garments for sale . With any profit, Mediatrice will reinvest in her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of women's and children's garments for sale.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita G. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 62 years old. Merlita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & biscuits. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & biscuits

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph Y. is from the village of Tagpako, Gingoog City. He is 45 years old. Joseph is widowed and has six adult children. To make a living, Joseph owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like sardines & mackerel in the local community. He also provides deliveries of fish to nearby neighborhoods. Joseph has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joseph is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like milkfish & mackerel. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Joseph from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish such as milkfish & mackerel.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labor for his rice cultivation business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth M. is from the city of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old. Janeth is married and has two school-aged children. Janeth owns and operates a motor transport service. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Janeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Janeth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rochel

texts.en:
Rochel S. is from the city of Malaubang Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Rochel is married and has two school-aged children. Rochel has a tricycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Rochel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Rochel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Rochel is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase an additional vehicle for the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rochel from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase an additional vehicle for the business

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en:
Melchora C. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Melchora is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Melchora owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like sardines, mackerel & milkfish in the local community. Melchora has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melchora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melchora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Melchora is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like sardines & milkfish. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Melchora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like sardines & milkfish.

loans.name: Placidie

texts.en:
Placidie is 53 years old. She is married with three children and she takes care of seven children. Her business is well-organized. She sells shoes. Her business is open from 5 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on the weekend and she has 20 years of experience in her business. 

Placidie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase different shoes to sell for women, men and children. With any profit, Placidie will reinvest in her business, and she will be able to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell for women, men and children.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Jocelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, beverages & biscuits in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan S., 43, is a married woman and the mother of six children, three of whom are married and living independently while the other three are enrolled in school. Her husband is S. Sim, 48, a local rice farmer and he also feeds a lot of fish in a pond behind his house for extra income. 

Phan S. makes a living by growing various crops and bean crops. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young. Phan S. wants to sow a new bean crop, but lacks funds. Phan S. is applying for this loan as an advance to buy bean seed so that she can start to plant, and also to buy fish-feed for their fish growing.

loans.use: to buy bean seed for planting and to buy fish-feed for her fish growing.

loans.name: Marie Solange

texts.en:
Marie Solange is 27 years old and married with two children, 4 and 5 years old. Marie Solange has a restaurant where she sells food such as Irish potatoes, rice, meat, etc. Her business is well-organized and she employees two people to help her. The business is open from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day and has been in operation for one year. 

Marie Solange has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more food for her restaurant. With any profit earned, Marie Solange will save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food such as Irish potatoes, rice, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
Digna C. is from the village of Samay, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Digna is married and has 8 adult children. To make a living, Digna owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copra & also green bananas in the local community. Digna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Digna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Digna is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts & bananas. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Digna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts & bananas.

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.en:
Cleopatra M. is from the city of San Roque, Ozamiz City. She is 62 years old. Cleopatra is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Cleopatra owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Cleopatra has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cleopatra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleopatra is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook food for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Cleopatra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to cook food for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  a larger variety of items to increase sales.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman six children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past 10 years, she has been making mahamri (dumplings) for sale. She also operates a furniture shop which contributes to her other source of income. She sells at retail to her neighbours and passersby. Mwanamisi faces a major challenge in the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour, as well as timber for her furniture shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy wheat and maize flour for making dumplings, as well as lumber for her furniture shop.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan T. is a garment factory worker in the Reussey Keo commune of Phnom Penh City. She gets a salary from her sewing job, and earns  approximately $1.50 a day. She doesn’t have a life partner as her husband died of illness. She has five children, two are single and three are married. 

To support their increasing daily expenses, two of her sons are working in different sectors. One of her sons is concerned that he has great difficulty with traveling and he needs to hire a motor taxi for going to work. To remedy this situation, Chan T. would like to borrow some funds to buy a new motor vehicle for her son.

loans.use: to buy a new motor vehicle for her son.

loans.name: Jacinta Wanjiru

texts.en:
Jacinta M. is a 36-year-old single lady. She has three children aged 16, 12 and 8 years old. She has been running her milk shop and motorcycle transport business for a period of one year with an income of about 13,000 Kenyan shillings a month.

This is her first loan from KADET after being introduced to it by a staff member. She has joined a  group of members to consolidate resources and buy a piece of land to be used jointly. She hopes to build rental houses and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land on which to build rental houses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi L. is a 32-year-old husband and father of one son.  Fadi and his partner have a small restaurant in the city of Ramallah and they want to launch another branch in Bethlehem city.

Fadi took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the items and ingredients needed to start up the restaurant services which will be launched in the coming few days.

Fadi who appears in the picture here wants to increase the profits that are divided between two partners.

loans.use: to purchase the food and ingredients necessary to launch his restaurant.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a peanut vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional peanuts to sell. 

Salvacion has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from retailing rice, fattening pigs, and wholesaling soft drinks. 

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business and of being able to buy a fishing boat.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of peanuts to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel D., age 40, is a fish vendor. Annabel has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. She and husband have two school-aged children and live in  the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 
 
In 2008, Annabel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Annabel has successfully repaid her most recent previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fish and other seafood products to offer for sale. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Annabel from GDMPC. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish and other seafood products to offer for sale

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 35 years old, married with four children aged 7 to 17 years. She has been selling men's, women's and children's used clothing in the market. Her business is open from 7am until 6pm every day except on Saturday, and she currently employs one person to help her. Vestine has four years experience in this business.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase a variety of men's, women's and children's clothing for sale. With any profits, she expects to save money for her future, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of second hand clothing for sale.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem S. is a low-income entrepreneur who earns a living by planting and harvesting rice crops on her farmland. She is able to earn about $2.50 per day from her farming business to help provide for the needs of the family. Nhem S.’s husband is a fisherman who catches and sells fish from  the river near his village. 

Nhem S. will use her loan to purchase a piece of fertile farmland, which will allow her to enlarge her crop-growing endeavors during the time that her existing land is fallow. 

She and her husband have a baby (shown in the picture) and two children enrolled in school.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of fertile farmland in order to expand her farming business

loans.name: Rosemary Wanjiru

texts.en:
Rosemary I., age 33, runs a motorcycle transport business. She has been engaged in this business for two years and earns an income of about 13,000 Kenya shillings. Her husband, Richard, also contributes to the family income. 
 
She is entering her first loan cycle with Kadet after being introduced to the organization by a group member. She has joined other group members to consolidate resources and buy a joint piece of land together, and it is for this reason that she is applying for a loan. 

Her goal is to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a shared piece of land along with other group members

loans.name: Abakundisuka Group

texts.fr: Albert S. est agriculteur du riz dans le secteur du Ruhuha, membre du groupe Abakundisuka, et client d’ACB depuis 2009.  Il a 31 ans, il est marié, et il a 3 enfants entre 2 ans et 8 ans.  Un de ses enfants va à l’école.  Il est né a Bugesera, au Rwanda, et il a une éducation d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son troisième cycle avec ACB, et il a une très bonne histoire de remboursement.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour l’achat des fertilisants, et le paiement de main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’unité des membres, et vivre dans une même agglomération, la lutte contre la pauvreté en travaillant sans chercher le repos, et la valorisation de la culture de riz dans sa région.  Il voudrait avoir les machines pour lui aider avec son activité, et avoir une vache au moins pour chaque membre du groupe.  Pour sa famille et lui-même, il voudrait avoir une vache pour donner le lait aux membres de la famille, scolariser ses enfants, et nourrir la famille convenablement.
texts.en:
Albert S. is a rice cultivator in Ruhuha sector, a member of Abakundisuka group, and has been a customer of Kiva's partner, ACB, since 2009. He's 31 years old, married, and has three children, aged 2 to 8. One of them attends school.

Albert was born in Bugesera, in Rwanda, and attended elementary school. He is seeking his third loan from ACB, and his repayment history is very good. He will use his loan to buy fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

His strategy for growing the group's business is its members' unity, living in the same agglomeration, fighting poverty by working restlessly, and valorizing rice cultivation in his region.

He would like to own machines to help him with his activity, and at least one cow for each member of the group. For his family and himself, he would like to have a cow to provide milk to the family members, send his children to school, and feed his family in a decent manner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for labour

loans.name: Mwanamzungu

texts.en:
Mwanamzungu is a married woman with two school going children. She lives at her own house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For over one year, she has operated a cloth selling business (Kikoi’s) selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  Mwanamzungu faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of Kikoi’s from Tanzania for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of Kikoi's for resale.

loans.name: John Kamau

texts.en:
John is 41 years old and married to Lucy Wanjiru, who contributes to the family income. They have six children and he has been running his motorcycle business for a period of about 8 years with an income of approximately 3500 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his first loan cycle in Kadet after being introduced by a staff member. He wants to use the loan to buy a piece of land with other members of his group. He hopes to improve his family's living standard and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Tajir

texts.en:
Tajir is a married woman who sells firewood and operate a cafe business. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past two years operating her business, she has been able to educate her children who attend school.  Tajir faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 29 years old and is married, with one seven year old child.  Jacqueline sells vegetables like tomatoes, peppers, onions etc in the market. Her business is well-organized and she has two year's experience in running it.  She works from 6am until 6pm every day, except on Saturday. She  currently employs three people to help her.

She has requested a loan from Kiva lender via vision finance company to purchase more vegetables for sale.  A variety of vegetables like peppers, tomatoes, onions and legumes etc to improve her business.  With any profit, Jacqueline will reinvest in her business and save for her future.
