loans.use: to purchase more vegetables like tomatoes, pepper, onion etc for sale.

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
From the Prey Chor district, Chab V. is the one of many people who earns a living with a farming business. On average, she can earn an income about $1 a day. In order to help support in the family, Chab V. works as a casual laborer, who spends most of her time in the construction field. 

Because of unsafe living conditions, Chab V. would like to request the loan to buy wooden planks in order to mend her wall, which is broken. She will use some percentage of the total loan to purchase construction materials to support her husband.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks in order to mend her wall and purchase construction materials for supporting her husband.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 47 years old, married to Regina, and a father of five children. He operates a stall at the Gikomba market, where he sells second hand shoes. This is his primary business and he has been doing it for the last eleven years. Gikomba market is relatively busy in terms of business and has a high population as well. This is favorable for his business.

This is his first loan with KADET and he plans to buy four bales of shoes for resale. He hopes that the returns he gets will be help him to expand his business further and give his family a better life.
 
In the future, he hopes to open a wholesale store for new shoes and distribute to other retailers.

loans.use: to buy four bales of shoes.

loans.name: C4709 Indahemuka Group

texts.en:
Eugene is 51 years old and is married without children. His business is well organized. Eugene is the leader of this group called "Indahemuka," which is well known in the business of selling bananas. Their business hours are from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day.

Eugene and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more bananas to sell.  With the profits from this, they will reinvest in their business and save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of shoes, handbags, and cosmetics to offer for sale

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um S. is a divorced mother caring for three children, one of whom attends the local school and is dependent on her income, while the other two work in a garment factory. A self-sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn money to support her children, she sells rice and vegetables to passers-by in her community.

Um S. will use the loan to buy more rice to store for future sale. This will allow her to gain more income and more valued customers, thereby enabling her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice to store for future sale.

loans.name: C4707 Intwari Group

texts.en:
Elisa is 22 years old and is single. He is the representative of a group called "Intwari" in the local language. Elisa is the first person on the left, with his hand raised. 

Elisa has a beauty salon in Kigali which attracts many working-class clients. He has been in this business for one year.  His beauty salon is well organized; he is open from 8am until 7pm every day and employs three people to help him. One of the challenges in his business is not having enough equipment in the hair salon, especially for women clients.

Elisa and his group have requested a loan from a Kiva lender in order to purchase new equipment for Elisa's beauty salon. With this profit, Elisa will reinvest in his business and save for his family.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for his salon

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school.  He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Said has operated a vegetable stall business for the past four years, selling at the market to his friends and neighbours. Said faces a major challenge of the perishability of products and seasonality in his business. He dreams of becoming self-reliant and establishing a grocery shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to renovate his stall and purchase sacks of cabbages, potatoes and onions. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to renovate his stall and purchase sacks of cabbages, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen Y. is 50 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia. She is married to Mr. Keo Horn, age 56, and they make a living planting crops in the village. This couple has given birth to nine children and two of them work as a garment worker and a local fisherman. Some of them also assist her in the farm field. In addition, she also sells different kind of goods next to her house. Because she doesn’t have the capital to grow a rice crop yet, she is asking for a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to import a variety of clothes from China.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is an Italian language student in Bethlehem University. She is a senior student and has to go to Italy to take a course to complete her degree.

Haneen took out a loan from FATEN to pay for her trip expenses. The course is very important for Haneen as she will be able to practice Italian and work on her research.

Haneen appears in the picture here in a FATEN branch office.

loans.use: to pay for attending an Italian language course.

loans.name: Bayambadorj

texts.en:
Bayambadorj is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife works at a water supply company, while his two children, aged 6 and 11, attend the local secondary school.

He manages a transportation service business in his town. He started his business in 2000 with his own truck. Mainly, he transports coal and wood between the center of the province and Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He is also planning to start an iron trading business in the near future. Currently, the value of iron has been raised immensely. Bayambadorj is a hard working and polite man who possesses essential business and leadership skills. He says, "I want to have my own house in order to live comfortably." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials for building a house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Bintiomar

texts.en:
Bintiomar is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 
 
For the past 5 years, she has had a farming business, planting maize, which she then sells. She faces a major challenge of bad weather conditions for the maize. She dreams of becoming a reliable supplier of vegetables in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: C5525 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Alphonse is 56 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 3 and 21 years. Alphonse is the leader of this group, called "Twitezimbere" in the local language, which means in English "let us develop." The group is well known in the business of selling meat. Alphonse`s business is well organized. His business hours are from 7 am until 7 pm every weekday, and he has five years of experience.

Alphonse and his team have requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of meat to sell. They really hope that, once this loan is given to them, they will be able to save for the future. If successful, they hope to earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to keep expanding their businesses until they become financially stable.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of meat to sell.

loans.name: Gunjmaa

texts.en:
Gunjmaa, age 37, manages an Internet cafe from a rented apartment. She has been engaged in her business for eight months. Before that, she operated a Canon photocopying service for about eight years.
  
Gunjmaa lives with her husband and two children in a house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a guard at APU Co., Ltd., the country's number one manufacturer of alcoholic drinks. They have two daughters: one is still a baby and the other, age 3, is enrolled in a local kindergarten. 
 
Gunjmaa has worked hard to stabilize her business and has built a strong customer base. She tells us that she plans to open an additional branch in the near future. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy a new computer and computer equipment in order to increase her business revenue.

loans.use: to buy a new computer and computer equipment

loans.name: Batbeleg

texts.en: Batbeleg is 56 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. They live in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent in his younger brother's backyard. His daughters, ages 20 and 22, go to a college. He manages a bag-trading business at a rented stall at Narantuul market, one of the busiest markets in Ulaanbaatar city. He started his business in 1998 with the help of his wife. Now they are saving their earnings in order to buy a plot of land where they can build a house. Batbeleg, an open-minded and serious man, says, "I am planning to have my own house this fall." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more bags in order to increase collection of his bags.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of bags.

loans.name: Rentsen

texts.en:
Rentsen is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Rentsen’s wife is unemployed and his two sons go to a local secondary school. For the past three years, he has run a photo service business. In order to increase his family’s earnings, Rentsen also started a taxi service business last year. 

Rentsen is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase a printing machine and some materials for his photography business. He is a good person who says, “I want to buy a printing machine with the loan.”

loans.use: to purchase a printing machine and photography materials

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman who owns a house without electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past three years, Asha has operated a vegetable stall where she sells tomatoes, green vegetables, potatoes, and onions. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Asha’s major business challenge is the price fluctuation in her products. 

Asha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and bananas for resale. In the future, Asha dreams of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, onions, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 59 years old and married with three children between the ages of 9 and 12 years old. Jean Damascene sells general merchandise (tomato sauce, soap, beer etc).  His business is well organized. He has two years of experience. Jean Damascene works from 6am until 7pm every day.

Jean Damascene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more goods like rice, sugar, body lotion, soap, beer, tomato sauce etc. With his profit, he will increase his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like body lotion, soap, beer, tomato sauce etc.

loans.name: Yonie Group

texts.en:
This photo shows members of the “Yonie Group.” They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner, to request a loan of 800,000 SLL for each member. The loan will be used to further expand their individual businesses. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu K.. She is 42 and was born in one of the villages that make up Sanda. Currently, she lives in Makeni together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a salaried worker and two of her children are in primary school, one is in secondary school and the other is in college. For the past ten years, Kadiatu has been selling shoes. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy dozens of shoes to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy dozens of shoes to sell

loans.name: Tawapaneh Group

texts.en:
This photo shows the members of the “Tawapaneh Group.” They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The group has come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner, to request a loan of 800,000 SLL for each member. The loan will be used to improve the size and quality of their individual businesses. 

The leader of this group is Mohamed T.. He is 28 years old and was born in a village called Konta. Mohamed is married to a trader and the couple has four children who are not yet school-going age. For the past nine years, Mohamed has sold sweets, biscuits, chewing gum, batteries, cigarettes, etc. With his share of this loan, Mohamed is going to expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items in bulk to increase his store inventory.

loans.use: to buy sweets, biscuits, gum, batteries, and cigarettes to increase store inventory

loans.name: C5530 Abakundamahoro Group

texts.en:
Marie Donatille is 51 years old and a widow with six children between 5 and 21 years old. She is the president of a group called “Abakundamahoro”. She is in the green dress. Marie Donatille sells various goods such as rice, sugar, bread, and biscuits.  Marie Donatille employs one person in her business to help her and has been working for two years. 

Marie Donatille is the first person on the left side. Marie Donatille and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more goods such as rice, sugar, bread, biscuits etc to sell. With her profits, Marie Donatille and her team would like to start saving, to reinvest in their business and to satisfy the basic needs of their family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods such as rice, sugar, bread, biscuits etc.

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is a 43-year-old single mother of three children who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. After separating from her husband, she decided to venture into cloth-selling to be able to support her family. Geneva has been in the textile business for fifteen years now. She started with capital of 500,000 shillings and now she has three million. Geneva’s business challenge is her limited capital. 

Geneva is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell. In the future, her dream is to own her own boutique and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard, 23, is a hard-working man who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in trading in maize for three years, starting with sales of 5-10 bags of maize per month and now selling 20-30 bags or 50 in a good season. His hardships are limited capital and high transport costs. His desire is to own a regional food store and to educate his children. Richard intends to use the loan facility to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and one sibling. He has been working as a freelance construction worker since 2007. His work consists in cleaning the floor with specialized machinery. This young man has recently hired one full-time employee to help him since his work is growing and he has stuck with multiple construction projects. 

He works hard in cooperation with his father to be able to pay the high cost of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his machinery and replace his old engine with a new one so that he can offer better service to his customers.  He is very positive about his future and looks forward to working on bigger projects.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his machinery and replace his old engine.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a young man from Bethlehem, one of seven brothers. Khalil finished school and couldn't get a job, therefore he started selling clothes and accessories. Khalil sells the items door-to-door using a small rickshaw.

Khalil took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a new variety of summer children's clothes and increase his sales and profit. Khalil is photographed at our Bethlehem branch.

loans.use: to purchase children's wear to sell with other items he already sells.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced with a grown son. She lives and runs her venture in Novaya Kahovka, selling women's clothing items in one of the local malls. She has been in this trade for 20 years. Presently, her turnover capital is 40,000 grivnas (UAH) and her income is about 13,000 UAH per month. 

Tatyana is requesting a 20,000 UAH loan to purchase seasonal merchandise to sell in her shop. Financial assistance will help Tatyana to increase her income and thus provide for her family needs and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 47-year-old married woman living with her husband and three young children who are still attending school. She is from Lebanon. She has worked in different tailoring factories for more than 20 years. In 1995, she started running her own business from her house. She is an experienced tailor, paying attention to every detail. She is very kind and knows how to deal with people. She helps her husband in paying the household expenses and especially the children’s education fees. She has taken advantage of a first Kiva loan and was an excellent client with prompt payments. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new, advanced tailoring machinery in order to improve her business. In the future, she expects to earn high profits to better support her family.

loans.use: to purchase new advanced tailoring machinery.

loans.name: Lazeri

texts.en: Lazeri, 37, is a married woman with seven children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She and the husband equally contribute to their family's welfare and their dream is to have self-sustaining children. She has been dealing in clothes for fifteen years. Having started with 800,000 shillings of capital, she now has three million. Despite the hardship of limited capital, her dream is to own a boutique. Lazeri will use the loan facility to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for his baby's room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her shop’s inventory.

loans.name: Emilo

texts.en: Emilo, 42, is a married man with eight children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He is solely responsible for taking care of his family and his desire is to educate his children to degree-level. He has been in the poultry business for two years and it has been profitable in spite of disease. Currently, he has 300 birds and his desire is to own at least 1,000 before next year. In order to keep the loyalty of his customers, he sometimes buys the eggs in order to meet their demand. For this reason, Emilo needs the loan to buy eggs for resale.

loans.use: to buy eggs for resale.

loans.name: Tadius

texts.en: Tadius, 32, is a married man with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for eight years. Having started with 300,000 shillings of capital, he now has one million. He dreams of owning a wholesale shop despite the hardship of lack of capital. Tadius needs the loan facility to buy soap and sugar for resale.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married with two grown-up children. She owns a small bakery located in a village close to Ivano-Frankivsk city. Eleven years ago she lost her job of pastry-cook because the company she worked for closed. Vera decided to start working on her own.
Vera was able to purchase an old building and turn it into a bakery. Absence of competitors enabled Vera's business to grow fast. She still owns the only bakery in this village. This is a family business that brings in a stable income. Vera would like to borrow 15,000 Ukrainian Hryvnias (UAH) to purchase five tons of flour. She will use it in her bakery over several months.

loans.use: to purchase five tons of flour.

loans.name: George Muhia

texts.en: George Muhia W. is 24 years old and married. He supports his parents, brothers, and sisters. He has a motorcycle transport business, which he has been doing for two years with an income of 4,800 KES a month. This is George's first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced by a staff member.  He will use the loan to buy a piece of land with a group. He hopes to improve his standard of living as well as expand his transport business.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a young woman from Jenin. Nabeela is a mother of one daughter and two sons. Nabeela's husband is a Paletsinian National Authority employee and receives a decent salary.

Nabeela, who is photographed above, and her husband purchase necessary pieces of furniture slowly as they can't furnish the whole house at once. Nabeela took out a loan from FATEN to purchase furniture for their sons' room.

loans.use: to purchase house furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old single woman living with one parent, a sibling and a cousin. She is from Lebanon. After the death of her father, she started to cooperate with her mother to be able to pay everyday expenditures. She opened a small beauty salon in 1994 and began to offer her clients professional hairdressing services. She is considered the best hairdresser in her town. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more beauty products and equipment. In the future, she will redecorate her salon and arrange a small area where she will offer additional beauty services such as make-up, laser, etc. This will be her second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products and equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two young children, both in school. He has worked in multiple grocery stores and mini-markets for 10 years. Then, he decided to open his own mini-market in 2008. He sells dairy and daily-use products, detergents, beverages, etc. He is the only income provider of the family. 

With his loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will purchase new merchandise to increase his sales and therefore his income. We note that he is a very positive man with high hopes for the future of his business.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 37 years old, married, and has four children. He owns a house in Kasese Uganda. The responsibility to provide for his family solely rests on him and his desire is to have a self-sustaining family. He has been in the retail business for eight years. His hardship is debtors who do not pay on time; his  hopes for the future are increasing his financial resources and educating his children. Robert is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy maize flour to sell.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 39-year-old married man. He has been involved in the agriculture field for the past 18 years. He owns a farm in his hometown in Lebanon, where he resides with his wife. His farm produces milk and its derivatives and different types of vegetables – all sold to the local markets. His revenue is very important since he is the main income source for the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase agricultural spices and seeds needed for his work. He says that with these purchases he will be able to better monitor his products, farming and growth.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural spices and seeds.

loans.name: Gorette

texts.en:
Gorette is 50 years old and married, with one child who is 21 years old.  She earns a living by selling men's clothes. This is her sixth successful year in business. Her business is well-organized. She operates her business from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her. 

Gorette has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy men's, women's and children's clothes to expand her business. By adding more products and workers, she hopes to earn more profit.  With the profit, she will save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Innoncent

texts.en:
Innoncent is 31 years old and single. He is a hairdresser. He works from 7 A.M. to 8 P.M. every day except Sunday. He has been in this business for two years. 

He has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more new materials for his beauty salon. In this way Innoncent will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to expand his beauty salon by purchasing new materials to help him.

loans.name: Francis Thuo

texts.en: Francis Thuo N. is 40 years old, married, and has two children. He has been running his butchery and motorcycle transport business for a period of 16 years with an income of 9,000 KES a month. This is Francis' first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced by a staff member. He is requesting a loan to buy a piece of land with a group. He hopes to own rental houses and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 32 years old and is married, with three children between 4 and 8 years old. Evariste works as a motorcycle driver. He has had his business for four years . His business is well-organized and he currently employs one person to help him. He opens his business from 6am to 10pm every day.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance company, in order to expand his business by purchasing a new motorcycle. With a profit, he will be able to build his own house and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 47 years old and is married with nine children between the ages of 1 and 23 years. 

Evariste has a boutique where he sells rice,soap,sugar,body lotion,juice and so on. He has 10 years' experience. His business is well-organized and clear.

Evariste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more beans, soap, sugar, water, juice, bread, cooking oil and so on. With the profits, Evariste will pay school fees for his children and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like soap, body lotion, sugar, rice, water and  juice.

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en:
Rashidi R. is in his early 30s, married, and has one child. He has been selling Irish potatoes for one year. He works from 11:00 am to 10:00 pm daily, but he also travels to deliver bags of potatoes.  He leaves the city at 6:00 am and stays upcountry for about two days.  When he returns, he delivers potatoes to his customers. He makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Rashidi's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more potatoes and has paid back his loans successfully.  He is requesting a loan to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes. His dream is start a video library.

Rashidi will share this loan with his loan group "Peace," which has 20 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Rashidi is in the middle of the front row in a red t-shirt.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of Irish potatoes.

loans.name: James Mwangi

texts.en: James Mwangi M. is 30 years old and single. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for two years with an income of 6,000 KES a month.  This is James' first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced by a staff member.  He is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy a piece of land with a group. He hopes to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land

loans.name: St.bruno Group

texts.en:
34 year old M. Vicent is a warm hearted and congenial business man who has been in the food sales business for the past 20 years. Vicent transacts his business from Nnono trading center food market in Mpigi.  He has principally been selling bananas, maize, rice and cassava.  When it comes to diligence, the happily married father of 4 has always come up to scratch.  

Vicent who many describe as self assured says he began selling food to supplement profits from his cattle sales business.  At the threshold, Vicent was a farmer.  He still does farming and it is his harvests that he sells.  Weekly he says this business generates him 180,000 Shillings in profit and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more crops such as rice, beans, cabbage, peas, sweet potatoes,etc to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of foods such as rice,beans,cabbage,peas,sweet potatoes,etc to resell

loans.name: Simon Kabere

texts.en:
Simon Kabere M. is 29 years old and married to Mary Muthoni, who contributes to the family income. He has two children aged one and three years old. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for a period of about two years with an income of 6,000 KES a month.

This is Simon’s first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. He wants to use his loan to buy a piece of land with his group members. He hopes to give his children a quality education and build rental houses.

loans.use: to use it to buy a piece of land with his group.

loans.name: Moonlight Group

texts.en:
Mary J. (in the front row, wearing a pink dress) is in her early thirties, married and has two children who are going to school. She has been running a cosmetics business for two years now in which she sells from door to door. She works from 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mary's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will share in this loan with her loan group, Moonlight, which has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

Mary used her previous loans to buy more cosmetics, sarongs, fabrics and powdered soap and has paid back her loans successfully. With her loan she hopes to still buy more cosmetics, sarongs, fabrics and powdered soap. Her dream is to get a stall one day from which she can sell her products.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, sarongs, fabrics and powdered soap.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter K. is 48 years old, married to Mary and the father of three children. Together with his wife, they do crop farming in Kirangari, near Kikuyu town. This has been his primary business for the last nine years. The Kikuyu area is good for farming, and he has a ready market.

This will be Peter’s second loan with KADET, and he plans to buy fertilizers and water pipes for irrigating his farm. These will ease his farming activities, while the piping will irrigate his fields when the rains are late.

Peter wishes to buy a truck to help in the distribution of his farm produce. He hopes to use his returns to give his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and water pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Josephiine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and is married, with three children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. She sells foods like vegetables, rice, tomato sauce, soap, etc.  Josephine has two year's experience. 

Josephine has requested a loan from KIVA lenders in order to purchase more food items like sugar, vegetables, rice, and tomato sauce.  With profits, Josephine will reinvest in her business and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuff, like vegetables, tomato sauce, rice, and so on.

loans.name: Jashon

texts.en:
Jashon K. is 32 years old and married to Eunice, who supports him in his business. He operates an M-PESA, which is a mobile money transfer operation. He works from Nairobi’s city center. His business is very busy because most people, and especially those in business, use mobile banking instead of carrying around currency. He has been in business for the last three years.

This is Jashon’s first loan with KADET, and he plans to increase his floating capital that he gets from Safari.com. He also wants to venture into the furniture business, so he plans to buy timber for making beds, chairs, etc. Jashon hopes to have his own business premises instead of renting, which will grow in expense in the future. He hopes from his returns that he will expand his businesses and give his family a better life.

loans.use: He plans to increase his float for the M-pesa business and also buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles K. is 33 years old and married to Zipporah who works as a livestock officer. He runs an internet cafe at Gitaru in Kikuyu. He has been in business for the last five years.

This is Charles’ second loan with KADET, and with it he plans to upgrade the equipment for his cafe. He hopes with his returns that he will be able to expand his business.

Charles hopes to open another branch in the next five years and to give his family a better life.

loans.use: Charles plans to upgrade his equipment in his internet cafe.

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Zuena M., is in her early thirties and a single mother with three children.  She has been running a beauty salon for three years now.  She works from 8.00am to 7.30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Zuena's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy salon equipments and has paid back her loan succeesfully.  She is asking for a loan to to buy a bit stock of salon equipments.  Her dream is to one day be able to take care of her children and manage to send them to good schools.

Zuena will share this loan with her loan group "Hakika" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Zuena is in a red and white dress at the back row.

loans.use: To buy a stock of salon equipment.

loans.name: Zablon Mwangi

texts.en:
Zablom Mwangi, 28, is a single businessman who supports his parents, brothers and sisters. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for about two years with an income of 2,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) per month.

This is his first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced by a staff member. He wants to use it to buy a piece of land together with his group members. He hopes to improve his living standard and to be able to expand his transport services.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land as a group.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 31 years old and is married with two children; 3 and 7 years old. He sells various goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, soft drinks, etc.. He works from 7am to 6pm every day except on Saturday. He has been in this business for 2 years and employs one person to help him. 

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. for his business. Emmanuel will be able to earn more profit, which will allow him to reinvest in his business and save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Faru Group

texts.en:
Esther Micheal is in her mid-thirties and married with two children. She has been running a pharmacy for two years. She works from 7.30am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Esther's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes to use it to buy more medicines. Her dream is to one day have a big pharmacy and a laboratory.

Esther will share this loan with her loan group "Faru" which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the photo, Esther is in the front and middle, wearing a light green blouse.

loans.use: to buy more medicines.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 43 years old and is married, with five children between the ages of  7 and 18 years. Her business is well organized. She employs three people in her business. Marie has one year's experience.

Marie has requested a loan from KIVA lenders in order to buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes. With profits, Marie will build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Mtazamo Group

texts.en:
Mary N., who is in her early thirties, is single and has a two-year-old daughter. She has been running a pharmacy since 2006. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and makes a small monthly profit.

This will be Mary's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With it, she will buy more medicines. Her dream is to one day build her own house as she already has the land.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group "Mtazamo" which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mary is in the front, first from the right.

loans.use: to buy more medicines.

loans.name: Emilse

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emilse; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pollipapa que es un plato que consiste de pollo y papas fritas y lo vende en forma ambulatoria en el distrito de Urubamba, la socia trabaja desde las 11:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de pollipapa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo y papas al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Emilse belongs to the Communal Bank “San Isidro de Yanahura – 5to Paradero” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has six children. Emilse divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling “pollipapa”, a dish that consists of chicken and fried potatoes. She sells her food as a street vendor in the District of Urubamba. Emilse works from 11am to 9pm. With this business, she has been able to help her children move forward. She wants to expand her food business, so she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for cooking such as chicken and potatoes in bulk.

Emilse is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients in bulk for cooking, such as chicken and potatoes.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, age 32, is married to Jastiner who is also in business and together they have two children aged three and four. He operates a retail shop where he sells items like cakes, detergents, tea leaves, sugar, maize and wheat flour, and rice among other food items. He has been running this business for eight years and he finds the business profitable. 

This is the first loan he is getting with KADET and he intends to use it to buy 10 bales of wheat flour, 220 Kgs of salt, 10 bales of Maize flour. 

He wishes that his business would grow such that he would open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy 10 bails of wheat flour, 220 kgs of salt, and 10 bails of Maize flour.

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.es:
Zacarías tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, tienen casa propia con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del caserío de Caracucho a unos 10 minutos del distrito de Morrope y a 30 minutos al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se dedica a l actividad agrícola, ganadería y tiene festividades religiosas muy bonitas.
Zacarías es comerciante desde hace 4 años de aves de corral y de cerdos, su corral se encuentra a unos 10 minutos de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos de su hogar.
Ha solicitado Zacarías un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más aves de corral y sus respectivos alimentos, con la finalidad de engordarlas para luego venderlas y tener un mejor precio y así mejoraría la calidad de vida de su familia.
Zacarías es un esposo y padre muy responsable que se preocupa por el futuro de sus hijos por eso trata que su negocio sea cada vez mejor.
texts.en:
Zacarías is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children. They receive services, such as water and electricity, and own a home in the rural section of the village of Caracucho. This community is ten minutes away from the District of Morrope and thirty minutes away from the Department of Lambayeque. Zacarías is a merchant who has been selling poultry and pigs for four years. His animal pens are located approximately ten minutes away from his house.

He provides his animals with balanced feed so that they will grow to the optimal size before being sold to different markets in the area. Zacarías is able to generate very good earnings so that he can cover his household expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that he can buy more poultry and the appropriate feed. He plans to fatten the animals so that he can sell them later at a good price. This will help him improve the quality of life for his family.

Zacarías is a responsible husband and father who is concerned about the future of his children. He strives each day to make his business better.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and the appropriate animal feed.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es: Miriam Del Carmen de 46 años, habita en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Doña Miriam posee un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en una pulpería en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad como bebidas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, detergente, jabón, etc. Tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar y gracias a su carisma y dedicación en el trabajo ha logrado posicionarse en la zona y cada día su clientela aumenta más. Es muy conocida y respetada por sus vecinos ya que ella siempre se preocupa por brindar el mejor servicio posible a sus clientes. Su sueño es ampliar su pulpería surtiéndola con variedad de productos. Por esta razón solicita este crédito y así invertir en golosinas, bebidas, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, detergente, papel higiénico, entre otros artículos atractivos para los clientes.
texts.en:
Miriam Del Carmen is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. Doña Miriam has a small business that consists of a store where she offers basic necessities such as drinks, rice, beans, sugar, candy, detergent, soap, and other products. She spends a great deal of time working and thanks to her charismatic personality and determination in her work, she has been able to establish herself in the area and attract more customers each day. Miriam is well-known and respected by her neighbors because she always concerns herself with providing the best possible service for her customers.

Her dream is to expand her store by stocking it with a variety of products. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in candy, drinks, rice, sugar, beans, soap, detergent, toilet paper, and other products that are popular with her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO D. YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Graciela; ella tiene 23 años D. edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. chicha (bebida a base D. maíz), ella prepara y venD. en forma ambulatoria, ella trabaja desD. las 10:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio D. venta D. chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz y jora para preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Graciela belongs to the Communal Bank “San Isidro D. Yanahura – 5to Paradero” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Graciela divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling “chicha” (a beverage maD. of corn). She prepares her product and sells it as a street vendor. Graciela works from 10am to 10pm. Through this business, she has been able to move her children forward. Graciela wants to expand and improve her business of selling “chicha”. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy corn for producing her product.

Graciela is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase corn for producing "chicha".

loans.name: Paloma Blanca Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama "PALOMA BLANCA" por la paz y la unión que representan. Se encuentra ubicado en toluca, Estado de México. La señora Beatriz A. tiene 31 años y dos hijos varones, se dedica a su negocio desde hace 8 años, Ella vende articulos para el hogar y de temporada de forma ambulante, este es su segundo prestamo que solicita para el crecimiento de su negocio, el cual utilizara para adquirir productos de temporada. Se siente  feliz y contenta de recibir un nuevo prestamo, su objetivo es lograr tener un local fijo y obtener una estabilidad economica con su familia para poderles brindar una mejor vida y educación para sus hijos para llegar a ser grandes profesionistas. Doña Beatriz es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora por esta razón quiere continuar invirtiendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
This group is called “Paloma Blanca” (White Dove) since the members represent peace and unity. This group is from Toluca in the State of Mexico.

Sra. Beatriz A. is 31 years old and has two sons. She has been in business for eight years. Beatriz sells household goods and seasonal products as a street vendor. This is the second loan she has requested to grow her business. The funds will be used to acquire seasonal products. She is happy and pleased to obtain a new loan. Her goal is to have an established location and achieve financial stability so that her family will have a better life and her children can receive an education that will help them become successful professionals. Doña Beatriz is a hardworking and enterprising individual, which is why she wants to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal products and household goods.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “PRO DESARROLLO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Anselmo, el socio tiene 57 años de edad; el socio es casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya son independientes y trabajan; el socio es costurero, el socio realiza diversos trabajos como la elaboración de chalecos, camisas, chaquetas; el socio tiene su negocio en la plaza principal y el desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de tela, hilos y materiales para su costurera. El socio solicita el préstamo para implementar su costurera. 

El socio se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Pro Desarrollo” (Pro Development) is located in the village of Pisac in Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

One of its members is Sr. Anselmo. He is 57 years old, married, and has three children who are already independent and working. Anselmo is a tailor by profession. He produces different types of garments such as vests, shirts, and jackets. Anselmo has a business in the main plaza and wants to invest in the purchase of fabrics, thread, and supplies for his tailoring shop. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to keep his business in operation.

Anselmo is grateful and wants to say that he will complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, and supplies for his tailoring shop.

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en:
Zakayo is 60 years old, married to Irene and the father of three children. He operates a fuel pump at the Gikuni trading center in Kikuyu Township where he sells fuel for domestic use. This is his primary business and he has been doing it for the last three years. 

This is his third loan with KADET and he plans to buy another pump so as to maximize his fuel sales. He hopes, from the returns, to expand his business and give his family a better life.
 
He hopes and desires to operate a petrol service station in future.

loans.use: to buy another fuel pump

loans.name: Joseph Gitau

texts.en:
Joseph N. is a 23-year-old single businessman who supports his parents, and brothers and sisters still in school. He has been running his business for about two years with an income of approximately 9,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is his first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced by a staff member, and he wants to use it to buy a piece of land with his group members. He hopes to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land as a group.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy funiture for his barber shop

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Modesta; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como chanchos y gallinas y también tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra hortalizas como zanahoria, repollo y lechuga y después lo vende en el mercado de Urubamba en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de hortalizas y crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales y semillas para su tierra de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Modesta belongs to the Communal Bank “San Isidro de Yanahura – 5to Paradero” which is located in the District and Province of Urubamba, Department of Cusco.

She is 37 years old, married, and has seven children. Modesta divides her time between her daily activities and her business of raising animals such as pigs and chickens. She also has a plot of land on which she grows vegetables such as carrots, cabbages, and lettuce. Modesta sells her produce at the market in Urubamba as a street vendor. Through these businesses, she has been able to help her children move forward. Modesta wants to expand both her businesses of selling vegetables and raising animals. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy animals and seeds to plant on her land.

Modesta is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase animals and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Joseph Mundia

texts.en:
Joseph Mundia G. is a 29-year-old, single businessman. He supports his parents, brothers and sisters. He has been running his motorcycle transport business for a period of about a year with an income of 9,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is Joseph's first loan cycle with KADET after being introduced by a staff member, and he wants to use it to buy a piece of land with his group members. He hopes to improve his living standard.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land as a group.

loans.name: Esther Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina es una madre de familia de 30 años, vive con su esposo  y sus 4 hijos, tiene su casa propia con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe), la cual se ubica en el distrito de San José a unos 10 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  San José es distrito muy bonito, tiene una playa tranquila para veranear, además cuentan con todos los platos a base de pescado y lo más importante sus pobladores se dedican a la pesca artesanal.
Adelina se dedica a la venta de pescado seco y salado, con una experiencia de 3 años, ésta actividad lo desarrolla en su vivienda, en la parte posterior a acondicionado unos palos de madera para el salado y posterior secado de su pescado a la intemperie (a la luz del sol), las cuales se encuentran a las orillas de la playa, una vez que está listo su producto lo vende en los mercados de la zona y tiene mucha clientela lo que le permite tener más ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades diarias.
El préstamo solicitado por Adelina a Edpyme Alternativa es de 2000 nuevos soles para implementar mejor el área donde realiza el salado y secado de su pescado, y su almacén para guardar su pescado listo, para poder atender a una mayor cantidad de clientela brindándoles un producto de calidad a un buen precio.
Adelina es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, una madre que desea tener un negocio más grande para dales un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adelina is a 30-year-old mother who lives with her husband and four children. They own a home that receives all the basic services (water, electricity, and drainage). Adelina lives in the District of San José, which is approximately ten minutes from the Province of Chiclayo. San José is a beautiful area that has a quiet beach for spending the summer holiday. In addition, it is known for its seafood dishes since most of the residents engage in the fishing trade.

Adelina sells dried and salted fish. She has three years of experience managing her business, which she operates from her home. Adelina has an area behind her house that is set up with wooden posts for the salting process. Afterwards, the fish is taken to the shores of the beach where it is set out to dry in direct sunlight. Once the fish is ready, Adelina sells her products at the local markets where she has many customers. This business enables her to have more income to cover her daily needs.

The loan Adelina is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa is in the amount of 2000 PEN and will be used to improve the area where she salts and dries the fish by constructing a storage shed where she can keep the fish that is ready for sale. This will enable her to serve more customers by providing a high-quality product at a good price.

Adelina is a hardworking and responsible individual. This mother wants to have a larger business so that she can provide her children a good future.

loans.use: to build a storage shed for keeping dried and salted fish.

loans.name: James Kamuya

texts.en: James Kamunya W. is a 27 years old, married and has two children. He has made a living by running a motorcycle business for the last two years and earns about 7,000 Kenyan shillings a month. He is applying for his first loan from KADET, after being introduced to our program by a staff member. He plans to use the loan to buy a piece of land, which he believes will help him improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cleofe; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz) y cerveza, ella prepara chicha y luego lo vende de forma independiente en su casa, ella trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de chicha. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor para preparar la chicha.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Cleofe is a member of the "San Isidro de Yanahura 5to Paradero" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Cleofe is 44 years old, married, and has six children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling 'chicha' (a corn-based drink) and beer.  She makes the chicha and then sells it independently from her home.  She works from 10.00am to 8.00pm and, through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Cleofe would like to expand her chicha business.  She is requesting this loan to buy corn wholesale for making chicha.

Cleofe is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale for preparing 'chicha'

loans.name: Jane Njagi

texts.en: James Njagi is 44 years old and married to Margaret Njoki. He has four children, who are 27, 24, 19 and 13 years old. He is a mechanic and makes a living running a spare-parts business. He has been in this line of work for 10 years and earns about 10,500 Kenyan shillings a month. He was introduced to KADET by another member of our program and is applying for his first loan, which he plans to use to buy more spare parts for his shop. In the future, he hopes to own a big garage and give each of his children a high-quality education.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a garage.

loans.name: Haidi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Haidi; ella tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de accesorios de celulares, ella trabaja juntamente con su esposo y venden cargadores, cables y celulares en el distrito de Urubamba, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de accesorios para celulares. La socia solicita el préstamo para accesorios para celulares al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Haidi is a member of the "San Isidro de Yanahura 5to Paradero" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Haidi is 22 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business which is a store selling cell phone accessories.  She works together with her husband and they sell chargers, cables and cell phones in Urubamba district.  Through this business, Haidi gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to expand her business selling cell phone accessories and is requesting this loan to buy cell phone accessories wholesale.

Haidi is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories wholesale

loans.name: Cipriano Javier

texts.es: Cipriano de 36 años, es una hombre que aspira mucho por su familia ya que inicio su trabajo desde muy joven ayudándole a su familia después de cumplí la mayoría de edad decidió incursionar en la venta de artesanías. El empieza a trabajar desde muy temprano, el tiene 3 hijos menores a su cargo pues se encarga de proporcionarle todo lo necesario. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere incrementar en su negocio comprando jarrones, canastas, florero, saleros, entre otros, para aumentar sus ganancias. El anhela seguir trabajando en el negocio.
texts.en: Cipriano is 36 years old.  He is a man who has a lot of aspirations for his family.  He started working when he was very young, helping his family.  When he came of age, he decided to start selling handicrafts.  Cipriano starts work very early in the morning.  He has three dependent children in his care and takes care of providing them with everything they need.  With the help of this loan, he would like to increase his business by purchasing decorative vases, baskets, flower vases, salt shakers, etc, to increase his profits.  His wish is to continue working in the business.

loans.use: to buy decorative vases, baskets, flower vases, salt shakers, etc.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 48 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 16 and 20 years old.  Her business is well-organized.  She has three year's experience.  Agnes sells Irish potatoes.

Agnes has requested a loan from the Kiva lender in order to purchase more Irish potatoes to sell.  With this profit, Agnes will reinvest in her business and as well as build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase more Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es:
Aunque toda su vida Alba Lucía R. Muñoz fue ama de casa, los problemas de salud que debió enfrentar y la necesidad de aportar con algún trabajo que pudiera realizar a cubrir los gastos del hogar, fueron lo que la impulsaron a iniciar con su negocio de sandalias y artículos de cuero que ella misma elabora. Y aunque no son grandes las ganancias que obtiene, a sus 41 años de edad, Alba se siente feliz de poder contribuir a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

 

En un espacio de su casa, este emprendedora realizó las adecuaciones correspondientes para poder trabajar sus productos, los cuales vende en ferias artesanales a las que asiste y en su hogar donde igualmente vende productos de uso personal y variedeades. Alba se siente afortunada porque además de ser parte activa de la familia, su trabajo como independiente le permite compartir con sus 2 hijos y desempeñar su rol de mamá. 

  

Alba Lucía debe surtir frecuentemente su taller de marroquinería para sacar nuevas colecciones pero su capital es reducido y no es suficiente para comprar el material necesario para generar la producción, por ello, necesita de un préstamo. Su visión de empresaria es poder tener  su propio almacén y que su marca y sus diseños sean reconocidos no sólo en su barrio si no también en toda la ciudad de Medellín.
texts.en:
Although Alba Lucía R. Muñoz was a housewife her whole life, pressing health problems and the need to contribute, by means of some type of work, to covering household expenses impelled her to start her own business selling sandals and other leather products which she makes herself. Although the profits from her business are not large, at 41 years of age Alba is happy to be able to contribute to improving her family’s quality of life. 

This entrepreneur made the appropriate adaptations to an area in her home in order to be able to fabricate her products which she sells at handicraft markets she attends and from home where she also sells personal use and other miscellaneous items. Alba feels fortunate because, in addition to being an active part of the family, working independently allows her to share with her two children and fulfill her role as mom. 

Alba Lucía must often supply her workshop with leatherworking materials in order to bring out new collections, but her capital is limited and insufficient to be able to buy the necessary items to generate her products. Thus she needs a loan. Her vision as businesswoman is to be able to have her own shop and that her brand and designs be recognized not only in her neighborhood but also throughout the city of Medellín.

loans.use: to purchase leather for making footwear.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es un padre de familia de 32 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en la casa de sus padres y cuenta con servicio de agua y luz solamente.  Su casa se ubica en el distrito de Tumán a una distancia de 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo.  En éste distrito sus pobladores laboran en el cultivo de la caña de azúcar para su posterior procesamiento y convertirlo en azúcar para elconsumo de las personas.
Leonardo se dedica ha manejar su mototaxi (transporte público utilizado por las personas en rutas pequeñas con un cupo máximo de 3 personas),  lo realiza trasladando a las peresonas que viven en su distrito de un lugar a otro. Pero también tiene su propia clientela e incluso lo contratan para llevar a niños a los diferentes centros educativos de la zona, ésto le  permite tener mayores ingresos para poder ayudar  de algún modo a solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  Otra forma de obtener más dinero es vendiendo algunas aves de corral que cría en su casa.

A solicitado un préstamo ha Edpyme Alternativa Leonardo de 2000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, ya que lo utiliza diariamente mañana y tarde y necesita realizar algunos cambios de respuestos, permitiendole garantizar un mejor servicio y obtenga a largo plazo mejores ingresos.

Leonardo es muy cocnocido por ser una persona  de confianza, muy respetuoso y responsable con su clientes que utilizan sus transpoprte, con el objetivo de seguir mejorando en la vida y mas adelante poder vivir con su familia en su casa propia.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a family man of 32 years of age who lives with his wife and children in his parents' home where they have only electric and water service. His home is located in the district of Tumán, 15 minutes away from the province of Chiclayo. The inhabitants of this district work growing sugar cane to be later processed and turned into sugar for consumption. 

Leonardo earns a living driving his moto-taxi (public transportation which is used on short runs with a maximum occupancy of three persons), carrying people living in his district from one place to another. However he also has his own regular customers who even hire him to carry their children to the various educational centers in the region. In this way he generates greater income in order somehow to help pay the daily living expenses in his household. Another source of money is through the sale of poultry which he raises at home. 

He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to do maintenance on his moto-taxi, since he uses it every day, mornings and afternoons, and must replace some parts, which will allow him to guarantee better service and, in the long run, better income. 

Leonardo is well known for being dependable, very respectful and responsible towards the customers who use his service. His goal is to continue improving in life and in the future to be able to live with his family in their own home.

loans.use: to maintain and buy replacement parts for his moto-taxi.

loans.name: María Nazaret

texts.es:
María Nazaret es una mujer emprendedora que hace algún tiempo soñó con crear un corral de cerdos para cuidarlos y engordarlos, ella y su esposo son personas trabajadoras, pero quieren en su tiempo libre cuidar de su propio negocio en primera instancia, ellos tienen 3 hijos y quieren en un futuro generar los ingresos necesarios para sacarlos adelante y darles la oportunidad de estudiar, igualmente sueñan con que este proyecto se convierta en un negocio familiar que pase de generación en generación. 

 

Su negocio apenas comienza, por lo cual necesitan capital para montar los corrales, comprar los cerdos y la alimentación necesaria para tener un próspero futuro, aunque saben que su peor enemigo es el invierno María quiere construir un lugar sólido que proteja no sólo la seguridad de su familia si no también la de sus animales, y así mejorar proporcionalmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Nazaret is an enterprising woman who some time ago had the dream of creating a corral for pigs where she could raise and fatten them. She and her husband are hardworking people, but wish in their free time to nurture their own business before all else. They have three children and want in the future to generate the necessary income to get them ahead and give them the opportunity to go to school. They also have a dream that this project would turn into a family business to be handed down from generation to generation. 

Their business is just starting up and thus they need capital to set up the pens, buy the pigs and the necessary feed in order to have a prosperous future. Although they know their worst enemy is the winter, María wants to build a solid place that will provide security not only for her family but for her animals, and so improve their quality of life in its measure.

loans.use: to set up pens, purchase pigs and care for them.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: El señor Henry se dedica a la confección y venta de blusas juveniles y calzas de tela lycra,  tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio, por las mañanas vende en su puesto fijo de la calle comercio y por las tardes se dedica a la confección de ropa a pedido y para cubrir los requerimientos de su puesto de venta, vive en casa de sus papás con sus dos hijos, por quienes trabaja todos los días sin descanso, poco a poco logro comprar las máquinas para tener un taller donde puede elaborar sus diseños en los colores y tallas que el mercado le exige, el crédito que solicito el Sr. Henry es para utilizarlo en la compra de tela lycra puesto que en primavera los costos de esta tela se elevan por tanto el prefiere comprarla cuando su precio es bajo, el Sr. Henry solicita crédito en la institución por recomendación de una cliente antigua y responsable.
texts.en:
Señor Henry earns a living making and selling children's blouses and Lycra stockings. He has a small workshop in his home. Mornings he staffs his regular stand in the business district, and afternoons he makes clothing to order and to meet the needs of his stand. He lives in his mom and dad's home with his two children, for whom he works every day without rest. Little by little he was able to buy the machines needed to have a workshop where he may make his designs in the colors and sizes that are in demand. 

The loan requested by Señor Henry is to be used for purchasing Lycra cloth, since in the springtime the cost of this fabric goes up and he prefers to buy it when its price is low. Señor Henry seeks a loan with the institution at the recommendation of a long-time, responsible client.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Edgar Pedro

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar,   se dedica al Servicio de Transporte, Hace Diez años. El señor empieza su jornada laboral desde muy tempranas horas seis de la mañana y concluye según como le fue en el día. Normalmente a las once de la noche, Tiene  51 años, Vive en la Zona del Plan 3000, Tiene Cinco  hijos dos que dependen de el y Los Otros trabajan y Estudian, Actualmente el necesita el crédito para comprar el motor para su vehículo y algunas reparaciones del vehículo como ser arreglos eléctricos y chapeado. Su Esposa vende comida en su propio domicilio, Son Personas responsables las cuales buscan día a día el bienestar y la superación para poder tener una vejez segura.
texts.en:
Edgar has worked for ten years providing transportation services.  He starts his working day at the early hour of 6:00am, and it ends depending on how well the day went, normally around 11:00pm.  He is 51 years old and lives in the Plan 3000 area.  He has five children, and two still depend on him.  The others work and go to school.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase an engine for his car and to do some car repairs, including electrical repairs and veneers.  His wife sells food in their home.  They are responsible people who seek well-being and improvement every day in order to have a secure old-age.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and purchase an engine.

loans.name: Danitza

texts.es: Danitza, de 20 años. Es una joven responsable y muy comprometida con su trabajo. Ella vive en compañía de su mamá Cirila, su papá Heber y sus 3 hermanos, en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Desde que cumplió 15 años, comenzó a asumir responsabilidades, pues apoyaba en las necesidades de su familia. Su actividad principal es “la agricultura”, donde siembra papa y arveja en sus terrenos propios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasar la mayor parte del tiempo junto a su mamá, quien vende la cosecha en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Asimismo se dedica todas las tardes en la venta de hamburguesas y gaseosas, en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó en su casa. Le va muy bien en ambas actividades, ya que le genera una ganancia de 80 soles diarios. Además de abrir hace poco una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, donde atiende todo el día. Sus planes son, mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, invertir en el abastecimiento de su tienda de comestibles y ahorrar lo máximo para poder ayudar a sus hermanos menores; para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Unión por el trabajo”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad que le brinda los integrantes de su asociación. Danitza, invertirá el crédito en la compra de gaseosas, sacos de arroz y azúcar para que venda en su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Danitza, 20 years of age, is a responsible young woman and very committed to her work. She lives in the company of her mom Cirila, her dad Henry and her three siblings in their own home, located in the small population center of Cayan. Since she turned 15 she began assuming responsibilities to help support the family's needs. Her primary business activity is farming in which she grows potatoes and peas on her own land. What she most likes about her work is spending most of the day with her mom, who sells the harvested crops at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. At the same time she spends afternoons selling hamburgers and soft drinks out of a small area in her home adapted for that purpose. She is doing very well at both businesses, as she generates a daily profit of 80 soles. In addition she recently opened a basics goods shop where she provides customer service throughout the day. Her plans are to improve the quality of her crops, invest in stocking her general store and save as much as possible to be able to help her younger siblings in order to offer them a better quality of life. 

She belongs to the communal bank "Unión por el trabajo" [Unity for Work] and this is her first loan with MFP. She appreciates the chance offered her by the members of her association. Danitza will invest the loan in the purchase of soft drinks, sacks of rice and sugar to sell in her general store.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bags of rice and sugar to supply her shop.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 20 años de edad que vive en su casa propia, cuenta  con los servicios de agua y luz; ubicada en el  zona rural del caserío de Yencala a unos 30 minutos del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta  zona se caracteriza por que sus pobladores se dedican a la comercialización de animales y agricultura.

Desde hace varios años José labora en la compra, crianza y venta de animales (aves de corral como pavos, gallinas y patos), su corral lo tiene en la parte externa de su casa para mayor seguridad y comodidad.  Sus aves de corral se venden rápido en los mercados que los ofrece por estar bien alimetadas y criadas con alimentos balanceados,  lo cual le permite a José aumentar sus ganancias para cubrir sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Por lo mismo José a solicitado un préstamo  de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Aleternativa para seguir comprando animales (aves de corral) para criarlos y venderlos al por mayor y menor en los distintos mercados la ciudad de Lambayeque y Chiclayo, también lo va utilizar para comprar alimentos balanceados para poder darles de comer bien a sus animales y  seguir incrementando sus ventas y de paso hacerse mas conicido en los distintos mercados que vende por tener un producto sano y de calidad.

José a pesar de ser un padre jóven es muy responsable y conocido por los comerciantes de la zona de los distintos mercados por ser un hombre honesto, trabajador y con muchas ganas de  mejorar en la vida y de sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
José is a 20 year old head of household who lives in his own home, which has water and electricity services.  It is located in the rural area of the town of Yencala, about 30 minutes from the department of Lambayeque.  This area is characterized by the work its inhabitants do with agriculture and livestock.  

For a few years, José has worked buying, raising, and selling animals (poultry such as turkeys, chickens, and ducks).  His corral is located in the outside part of his house for more security and comfort.  His poultry sells quickly at the market because they are well-fed and raised with balanced feed, which allows José to increase his income to cover the daily necessities of his household.

José has requested a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to continue purchasing animals (poultry) to raise and sell them at wholesale and retail in the markets in the cities of Lambayeque and Chiclayo.  He will also use the money to purchase balanced feed to be able to feed his animals well, and continue increasing his sales and make himself more well-known in the different markets for having quality, healthy products.  

In spite of being a young parent, José is very responsible and is known by the businesses in his area for being an honest, hardworking man who wants to improve his live and get his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry and animal feed.

loans.name: Nohy

texts.es: Nohy, de 20 años; es un responsable hijo. Pues cuida y apoya a su mamá Rosalinda, su papá César y sus 2 hermanos. Con quienes vive en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. Con la seriedad que lo caracteriza, cuenta que hace 5 años se dedica a la agricultura. Desde muy joven asumió las responsabilidades de sus terrenos agrícolas, decidiendo que nuevos frutos sembrará y la distribución de los ingresos, juntamente con sus padres, a los que apoya incondicionalmente, con la ilusión de poder verlos descansar y brindarles la tranquilidad que necesiten. De los terrenos agrícolas que posee, tiene 2 hectáreas propias, que le fueron heredados por sus padres. Donde siembra papa de todas las variedades; los cuales después de un buen cuidado y mucho esmero los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver crecer sus cultivos. Por ello más adelante desea mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas, invirtiendo mayor capital de trabajo. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Unión por el trabajo”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se siente agradecido por el apoyo que le brindaron.
