Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia decidió hace poco empezar un negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo y nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien, antes vendía comida pero no le fue muy bien por lo que decidió dedicarse a las ventas, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las mañanas ya que al medio dia tiene que prepara el almuerzo para sus hijos y de allí en adelante se dedica a ayudar a su hijo pequeño en las tares de la escuela. La mercadería la recibe en el centro en una distribuidora.

Es para eso que solicito este crédito, para comprar zapatos y sandalias ya que tiene varios encargos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir con este negocio y  seguir creciendo cada dia.
texts.en:
The Colon communal bank meets every two weeks in the Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital known as the Valley City as it is surrounded by many hills.  In this location most people are involved in agricultural activity.

Here we meet Mrs. Rosa, age 39, who is married and has two children, ages 19 and 10.  The eldest started college this year and the youngest in in school.  Her husband works as a Coca Cola salesman.  This is her third term in the communal bank and she enjoys it because of the support she has always received.

Rosa is a great homemaker who, in order to help her husband with the household expenses, decided to set up a business selling shoes by catalogue.  She says it is going very well.  Before she was in the food business but it did not go so well and she decided to change.  She works every day mainly in the morning since she has to make lunch for her children.  She also helps her smallest son with his homework.  She picks up the merchandise she orders at a distribution center.

She is requesting a loan to buy shoes and sandals which have been ordered by customers.

Her dream is to stay in business and continue growing on a daily basis.

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than S. is 37 years old and works hard growing many kinds of crops. She earns about $1.50 a day, which means she must be very careful about what she spends money on. Her husband also works in the field with her. The main problem they face is that they do not own a well, and they are applying for this loan to hire laborers who can dig one for them. She is very grateful for the help she receivbes from Kiva. In this photo, which was taken inside their house, we see Than S. and her husband.

loans.use: to hire laborers to dig a well.

loans.name: Jeje May

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jeje May works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-dealing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling Avon and Natasha products. Jeje May is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase an additional fish cooler and fish to sell for her fish-dealing business.

Jeje May has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish and a fish cooler.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from catering services.  Mary Ann is borrowing 28,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel works hard to support her family. Maricel is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Maricel requested a 16,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy a fishing boat and materials for drying fish.

Maricel has been in this business for four years now, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and materials for the drying of fish.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair her old house.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a home-products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy additional stock of home products to sell.

Luisa has been in this business for two years. Luisa earns more income from raising pigs.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of home products to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from abaca (a plant fiber) weaving. Vilma is borrowing 13,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more RTW (ready-to-wear) products to sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 35 years old and married with four children.

Antonieta works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells livestock in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

Antonieta has borrowed and paid a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the livestock business for 14 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Antonieta aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Elenita Languido's Group

texts.en: Elenita is a married woman with three adult children. She is 52 years old and has had a food-selling business for 10 years. She sells vegetables like cabbage, eggplant and some other varieties to generate profits daily. Elenita has been in this business for 10 years. She is the group leader of her group of seven members. They have individual loan requests and will pay collectively every week. Elenita is requesting a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos to buy vegetables to sell such as pechay (cabbage), tomatoes and potatoes too. In the future, Elenita hopes to provide a sustainable livelihood for her family to progress. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell such as pechay (cabbage), tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Ma. Jesse

texts.en:
Ma. Jesse is 57 years old and married  with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Jesse buys and sells surplus television sets in the Philippines. Ma. Jesse requested a 16,000 Philippines pesos loan amount through NWTF to buy surplus television sets to sell.

Ma. Jesse has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Jesse would like to earn more income to support her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase surplus televisions to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en:
Elisabeth is a 55 year old widow and the mother of 8 children. They are: 
• Yoseph, 31 years old and married
• Daniel, 29 years old and married
• Joksi, 27 years old 
• Sofia, 25 years old 
• Roy, 23 years old 
• Mariana 23 years old 
• Aprianto, 19 years old 
• Fina 17 years old and in the second grade of Senior High School

Elisabeth and three of her children live in a modest house in Airnona Village. Since her husband passed away 8 years ago, Elisabeth has had to struggle in meeting their household needs by selling sprouts. Elisabeth has been with the TLM group lending program for 2 loan cycles.

Since she is still responsible for 3 of her children, Elisabeth has a desire to run another business breeding piglets, so she plans to buy piglets to raise. She needs business capital to make her dream come true. TLM has assisted her before by providing her a group loan, so now she is requesting an individual loan amounting to 10,000,000 IDR to buy piglets and fodder (feed). She really needs the assistance from TLM in supporting her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and fodder (feed)

loans.name: Dally

texts.en:
Dally is 41 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

Dally is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Dally requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy livestock to sell.

Dally has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dally would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy livestock to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
In Siem Reap province, Heng P. is a good man who has a strong determination to conduct his business. Now, Heng P. is a boat ferry deliverer, using this boat to pick up passengers and tourists who wish to cross a river. He earns approximately $4 each day for doing this. Besides the boat-delivering business, he also helps his wife with a home business selling and renting CDs, VCDs, and other media players. Almost all of their customers are people who live near their house. 

Heng P. would like to ask for this loan for his wife to purchase extra media players, music discs and other equipment that will help his wife’s business attract more valued customers and earn extra income.

loans.use: to purchase extra media players, music discs and other equipment for his wife to sell.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 45 years old and married with 4 children.  Emelia works very hard to provide for them.

Emelia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries for her sari-sari store business.  Emelia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, cooking oil, milk powder and other groceries. 

In the future, Emelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 49 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Vilma has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock to sell to customers.

Vilma has been in this business for 25 years.  In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Norma

texts.en:
Maria Norma is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Norma has a food production sales business in the Philippines. Ma. Norma requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food products business.

Ma. Norma has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ma. Norma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food products business

loans.name: Melany

texts.en:
As a married parent of 12 children, Melany R. works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Melany has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.

Melany is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store business.

 She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more item products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna B., 51, is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. 

Lorna has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lorna requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.

 In the future, Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is a 39-year-old married lady. She is blessed with two children. Jordan is 8 years old and is in the second grade of elementary school, and Erly is 4 years old and not yet  at school. Kristina also adopted a young girl, Marlince, who is 16 years old and in the first grade of senior high school. 

Kristina and her children are living in Belo Village. She is married to Pelipus, a 40-year-old taxi driver who is living in Irian Jaya, one of the provinces in Indonesia.

Pelipus usually sends money to Kristina, but it is not sufficient to fully cover their living. Moreover, Pelipus also needs money to live in Irian Jaya. 

Kristina has been running a kiosk business for eight years with her own capital, but the business is not developed well due to the limited capital that she has. 

Kristina intends to add stock for daily needs in her kiosk such as instant noodles, snacks, coffees, sugar, etc. Kristina is hoping that TLM is willing to help her by providing a loan. She is requesting a loan of IDR 4,000,000 to purchase more stock for the continuation of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock such as instant noodles, snacks, coffees, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Huth

texts.en:
Huth H. is a 43 year-old village woman wH. lives in Siem Reap province. She has tried her utmost to earn money by changing many occupations in order to make money.  In the past, she caught fish.  Now she runs a small business selling various goods at a wooden kiosk in her community.  Her husband is a fisherman wH. works along Tunle Sap River. They are blessed with six children.  Two are married and the other four are single. One of them assists with her business. 

Because of her smart management, Huth H. has increased the number of new clients coming to buy her products.  She has planned to grow her inventory.  Huth H. would like to borrow funds from Kiva in order to purchase extra goods in larger amounts than before so that she can satisfy both old  and new customers.

loans.use: to purchase extra goods to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga S. is from the village of Dullan, Aloran. She is 65 years old, married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Dominga makes and sells snacks. Dominga has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. 

Dominga joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. 

Dominga is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, with which she will purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending. This will be the second loan taken out by Dominga from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 29 years of age and married with three children. She has a business selling baked goods in the local community. She has three years of experience in this business. 

Marina needs a loan of 1450 Samoan tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 100 talas or about $42 US per week) to improve and expand it. 

Marina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Marina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making baked goods

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna Macapia is a married woman with three adult children. She is 52 years old and has had a food-selling business for 15 years. She sells fruits and vegetables like ripe mango, cabbage, tomatoes and lot more to the people in her community. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP monthly. 

Edna is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase a different variety of fruits like apples, oranges, pears and also to buy dressed chickens in order to increase her her income. 

In the future, Edna hopes to attract more customers and have a big business to make her family more economically stable.

About ASKI: 

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a different variety of fruits like apples, oranges, pears and to buy dressed chickens.

loans.name: Tres

texts.en:
Tres A. is a 39 year-old businesswoman who sells different types of fresh fish. By running this business, she can generate an income of US$4 per day to cover the entire family. Her husband also earns an income, driving a motor taxi for profit. Tres A. has five kids. Two of her children are now married and live in their own houses, while the remaining three are single. Most of them are employed and contribute a bit of income to the family.

Tres A. would like a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land for farming.

loans.name: Savang

texts.en: Mrs. Savang C.. a 37-year-old widow with three sons, all attending school, lives with them on National Road Number One about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Savang, a fruit-seller, buys her produce from a Phnom Penh market and resells it in front of a garment factory. She is requesting her first loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike to carry her fruits.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to carry her fruits.

loans.name: Samhart

texts.en:
Miss. Samhart S. (pictured here), 23, is single. She lives with her sister and parents approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samhart is a fast food seller. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her sister to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her sister to drive to work.

loans.name: Isidra Agbayani's Group

texts.en:
Isidra A., a married 58-year-old, is the leader of a small group with humble livelihoods. For 10 years, Isidra has operated a retail shop that sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods and some snack foods in the community. She earns about PHP 2,000 each month. Isidra is requesting PHP 5,000 as her portion of this loan to buy stock such as soft drinks and snacks to sell. She and the other members hope that their respective businesses will further grow for the benefit of their families.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla P., 31, and her husband, Mr. Sopheak Kul, 29, have been married since 2001 and have three daughters, two of whom are in school while the third is yet too young to attend. The family lives along National Road Number One, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Both Phalla and her husband are farmers, and they also buy flowers and bananas from fellow villagers and transport them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Phalla is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: The woman in the photo, Kong P., is a local farmer, who earns a living by planting rice in the province of Kompong Tom. Kong P., aged 49, was married but divorced her husband years ago. She has seven children, five of whom are married. Four of her children live separately, while the other three are still staying under her roof. The three who currently stay with Kong P. are employed in various jobs and they contribute their small incomes to the family’s needs. Kong P. is asking for a loan to buy many sacks of fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy many sacks of fertilizer and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cows and oxen for resale.

loans.name: Sovanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovanthy S. is 37 years old and her husband, Mr. Niyann Huy is 43 years old. They have been married since 1993 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Their children are in school. The family lives in suburb  approximately twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh.  

Sovanthy sells dessert. She buys ingredients from the market and makes dessert by herself and sells it in her village. Her husband is a security guard. She is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum H. raises many piglets to sell when they are big enough, which is a popular job in the countryside. Sum H. has over three years of experience in raising pigs. Her husband generates an income by selling firewood. Sum H.’s husband uses his motor trailer to pick up firewood to sell in Baray. Now he wants to purchase a new plowing machine. He will be able to use the plowing machine in their farming business and can also use it to transport his items to sell. This is the reason that Sum H. would like to request a loan from Kiva. She is very happy and thanks the lenders who make her loan possible.

loans.use: to purchase a new plowing machine.

loans.name: Sokchhiv

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokchhiv H. and her husband, Mr. Meanup Som, live in suburb approximately twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and two daughters. Three are in school and another one is still young. Her husband is a motor taxi driver.

Sokchhiv sell rice and other foods in front of a garment factory. She uses her motorbike to transport food from her house to the factory every day. Unfortunately, the motorbike was stolen. That’s why she is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for carrying her food.

loans.name: Sokden

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokden Y.  and her husband, Mr. David Phun, live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons. All of them are in school. 

Sokden sells batteries. They buy batteries from a nearby village and sell them in a market located in Phnom Penh. Sokden is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.use: To purchase neighboring land to expand her property.

loans.name: Sokphun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokphun D. is 42 and her husband, Mr. Phunly Kong, is 51. They live along National Road Number Six outside Phnom Penh. They have nine children: two sons and seven daughters. One is married and lives in separate home, one is a security guard, two are garment factory workers, one is a gas station attendant and the others are in school. Mr. Phunly Kong is a commune leader assistant.

Sokphun stays home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband's and children’s salary. She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her daughters to get to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her daughters to get to work.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan U. (pictured with her daughter) is a widow with one son and two daughters. Two are married and one lives outside the family home. Another one lives in the family home and he is a horse cart driver. Another one is a farmer. The family lives in a village across the Mekong River aboU. 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.   

Mrs. Phan U. sells fish. She buys fish from the fisherman in her village and sells them in a local market. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to purchase a horse for her son’s business driving a horse cart, because his horse was stolen.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for her son’s business driving a horse cart.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophan S. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Chea, have been married since 2001.  The couple has three children:  one son and two daughters. Two attend school, and the third one is still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophan is a weaver. She is requesting another loan of $500 to repair a motorized hand tiller for her parents, who are farmers.

loans.use: To repair a motorized hand tiller for her parents.

loans.name: Sokhoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhoeurn S. is 31 years old and her husband, Mr. Punlork Pol is 36 years old.  They live in a village along National Road Number one, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1996 and have three children: one son and two daughters, who all attend school. 

Sokhoeurn and her husband are farmers. In addition, Mr. Punlork Pol is also a barber. Sokhoeurn is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. 

Photo: Mrs. Sokhoeurn S. and her husband are pictured at home.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. M. is a 40-year-old rice farmer who resides in the province of Kompong Cham. She has a plot of land where she plants vegetables and other crops to generate income. She has three children who have completed school. One daughter stays with her; she is employed as a garment factory worker. Her husband earns a daily income by cuting old trees to make firewood. Touch S. wishes to buy a new motorcycle so she can transport her vegetables to sell in the market. She will also be able to ride anywhere without renting a motor taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to transport her vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman M. was born in 1973 in Uzhanis village, near Kapan. He is married and has a son and a daughter.  Roman now attends distance-learning courses at the Agricultural Academy in the city of Sisian.

Roman has engaged in farming for a long time.  He raises cows and chickens, grows wheat, and also keeps bees.  At the same time, Roman has been managing a butcher shop in Kapan, where he sells meat and dairy products from his farm. Thanks to the income from these occupations, Roman is able to take care of his family and pay for his education. 

Roman is seeking an 800.000 AMD loan to buy a car, which he will use to transport produce from his farm to his butcher shop in Kapan. This is Roman's fourth loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy a car, which he will use to transport his farming produce

loans.name: Ana Felicita

texts.es: Ana Felicita, D. 71 años D. edad. Ella posee una tienda con la que mantiene su hogar; Ana es una señora D. avanzada edad pero eso no la detiene, sino como debe ser, aprovecha su experiencia para satisfacer a sus clientes, siempre se encuentra activa  y por medio D. su negocio complace sus deseos D. seguir adelante y es una forma D. compartir vivencias con sus clientes; por la dicha a que el lugar donD. se situa el negocio es muy concurrido, cada día se aumenta el número D. la clientela, además al buen servicio, buena calidad D. los productos y buenos precios, ha hecho que Ana genere la preferencia D. las personas que la buscan. Como toda excelente vendedora quiere mantener feliz al cliente, es por eso que se decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita abastecer el negocio con productos como granos básicos, azúcar, bebidas, golosinas que no tiene actualmente. D. esta forma Ana lograra satisfacer a las personas y podrá mantener la seguridad económica en su hogar.
texts.en: Ana Felicita is 71 years old. She has a store with which she supports her household. Ana is a woman of advanced age, but that doesn't stop her. She is always active, and through her business she satisfies her desire to advance herself and she satisfies the needs of the customers who visit her. Because the area is very busy, the number of customers increases every day, since with good service, good quality products, and good prices, Ana has won people's business. And of course, like every excellent saleswoman, she wants to keep her customers happy. For this reason, she decided to apply to Integral for a loan that will permit her to stock her business with products like basic foodstuffs, sugar, beverages, candies, etc. In this way Ana will succeed in satisfying her customers and will be able to maintain the economic security of her home.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, sugar, beverages, and candies for her store.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun P. is skilled at cultivating different kinds of crops. She can plant her crops in both the dry and the rainy seasons. She earns about $1.50 USD each day from her farming business. Because the rainy season is coming, Chhun P. would like a loan to hire a machine to plow her farmland, and to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides to protect her crops. Her husband also works with her on the farm. She is blessed with two children who still live under her care.

loans.use: to hire a plow and to buy fertilizer, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Nury Lizeth

texts.es: Nury Lizeth Q. de treinta y cinco años de edad vive con su hija y su madre en casa alquilada en el departamento de Santa Ana. Ella posee un negocio donde tiene venta de artículos plásticos y de artículos de aluminio; el lugar es muy concurrido de personas y es por eso que Nury se ha hecho de mucha clientela además de que ella es una mujer entusiasta, está feliz con su trabajo y contagia a los que la visitan con mucha alegría; en su negocio posee artículos de gran variedad, de buena calidad y a un buen precio últimamente sus artículos se han vuelto muy solicitados es por eso que le pide a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar sillas plásticas, cubetas, cantaros, ollas de aluminio entre otros, para así poder satisfacer las necesidades de las personas que le compran y al mismo tiempo sacar adelante a su familia dándoles una mas vida digna y plena.
texts.en: Nury is 35 years old and lives with her mother and daughter in a rented home in the department of Santa Ana. Nury has a business selling plastic and aluminum items. The business is located in a busy place, which is why Nury has developed a large clientele, along with being a very enthusiastic and happy person at work, and that rubs off on the people who visit her. Her business has a wide variety of high-quality products at good prices, and lately her items have been in very high demand. That is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Intergral that will allow her to purchase plastic chairs, buckets, jugs, aluminum pots and other items so she can satisfy her customers' demands and at the same time make headway for her family by giving them a more dignified and fulfilling life.

loans.use: to purchase plastic chairs, buckets, jugs, aluminum pots and other items

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: Luis Eduardo M. S. de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hija en casa propia en el departamento de Santa Ana. El posee un negocio donde vende artículos plásticos y ropa; Luis se levanta desde muy temprano a vender pues es un hombre trabajador  y piensa que lo que con mucho trabajo se adquiere más se ama, Luis valora mucho su actividad laboral y se encuentra muy orgulloso de darle el mejor ejemplo de subsistencia a su hija. Luis es uno de los mejores vendedores del lugar ofrece el mejor servicio y vende su producto a un buen precio, en estos tiempos ha aumentado su clientela y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad de comprar cubetas, guacales, cantaros, ropa entre otros; para de esta forma satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y que siempre regresen por su negocio. Además confía que por este medio podrá darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen dándoles una estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Luis is 46 years old and lives with his partner and daughter in his own home in the department of Santa Ana. He has a business selling plastic items and clothing. Luis gets up very early in the morning to sell his items because he is a hard-working man who thinks what you acquire through hard work is what you love the most. Luis really values his job and is very proud to provide a good example for his daughter. He is one of the best merchants in the place where he works, selling his products at a good price. At this time, he has increased his clientele and is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral so he can purchase buckets, crates, jugs, clothing and other items. In this way he can meet the needs of his customers who are always coming back to his business. He hopes through these means he will be able to provide his family the quality of life they deserve by giving them economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase buckets, crates, jugs, clothing and other items.

loans.name: Jeny Yamileth

texts.es: Jeny Yamileth V. L. de treinta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos en el departamento de Santa Ana. Ella posee un puesto donde comercia calzado de todo tipo. Jeny es una madre de familia extraordinaria que desea sacar adelante  a su familia por medio de la dedicación a su actividad laboral; todo el día tiene la mejor sonrisa para los clientes que la visitan les ofrece un buen servicio y siempre tiene a la mano lo que las personas necesitan; a Jeny no le gusta decepcionar a su clientela y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad de comprar calzado de todo tipo como: tenis, zapatillas, sandalias, zapato escolar, entre otros; de esta forma tendrá a flote su negocio y mantendrá satisfecho al cliente, además tiene fe que con el esfuerzo que realiza día con día para llevar el sustento a su hogar en un futuro dará a su familia una vida plena que cubra todas sus necesidades.
texts.en: Jeny is 30 years old and lives with her partner and four children in the department of Santa Ana. She has a post where she sells all types of footwear. Jeny is an extraordinary mother who wishes to make headway for her family by dedicating herself to her work. She has the best smile for all of her customers throughout the day, providing them good service, and she always has on hand what people need. Jeny doesn't like to disappoint her customers and is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Apoyo Integral to purchase all kinds of footwear, such as tennis shoes, slippers, sandals, school shoes and other items. In this way she will keep her business afloat and continue satisfying her customers. Jeny has faith that with all her hard work from day to day to provide for her household she will in the future give her family a full life and cover all their needs.

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of footwear, such as tennis shoes, slippers, sandals, school shoes and other items.

loans.name: María Victorina

texts.es:
María Victorina vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella posee una sala de belleza muy famosa en el lugar donde vive, pues el trabajo de María es de muy buena calidad siempre está a la vanguardia con los estilos de corte y peinados que les realiza a sus clientes; para ella la recompensa del trabajo bien hecho es la oportunidad de mantener los clientes y atraer a nuevos. 

La clientela ha aumentado y María quiere darles la mejor atención, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material de trabajo como shampoo, cremas para el cabello, cosméticos, tijeras, peines, entre otros; de esta manera María podrá mantener su calidad de trabajo y podrá vender al cliente lo que necesita con referente a artículos de belleza. 

Además tiene esperanza que este medio de trabajo le dará la oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en el hogar.
texts.en:
María Victorina lives with her life partner and her son.  She owns a famous beauty salon in the area.  María's work is of very good quality, and she is always is on the vanguard of new haircuts and styles that she does for her customers.  For her, the reward for work well done is the opportunity to keep customers and attract new ones.  

Her customer base has grown and María wants to give them the best attention, so she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that allows her to purchase materials like shampoo, hair creams, cosmetics, scissors, combs, and other items.  In this way, María can maintain her quality of work and can sell her customers the beauty products that they need.  

She also hopes that this working environment will give her the opportunity to improve her family's quality of life at home.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair cream, cosmetics, scissors, and combs.

loans.name: Santos Dionicio

texts.es: Santos Dionicio C. M. de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su familia en Santo Domingo en el departamento de San Vicente. El se dedica a la crianza de pollos en una granja, los vende por destazo o enteros; Santos es uno de los mayores abastecedores de pollo en el lugar pues tiene los mejores a un buen precio, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente y no quiere perder la oportunidad de incrementar su mercado es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pollos, concentrado, agua entre otros para mantener activa la producción, de esta forma Santos no decepcionara a sus clientes y el lograra acrecentar el negocio, Santos piensa que entre más productivo sea su trabajo hará mas feliz a su familia y tendrá la posibilidad de darles una vida mejor.
texts.en: Santos Dionicio C. M., 43, lives with his life partner and his family in Santo Domingo in the department of San Vincente.  He raises chickens on a farm, which he later sells whole or cut in pieces.  Santos is one of the main chicken suppliers in this place, because he offers the best chickens at a good price.  As a result, he has had a lot of customers lately, and he doesn't want to lose this opportunity to increase his market share.  For this reason he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy chickens, feed, water and other supplies to support his production.  In this way Santos will not disappoint his customers and he will be able to make his business grow.  Santos thinks that as his work becomes more productive he will have a happier family life and will have the opportunity to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and water

loans.name: Rosa Refugio

texts.es: Rosa Refugio, vive con su compañero D. vida y se dedica a la venta D. granos básicos y leña en un lugar accesible D. la zona en la que vive, es visitada por muchos clientes todos los días, pues es muy servicial y siempre tiene lo que el cliente necesita. Para Rosa lo que importa es cuanto amor le pone a su trabajo para que este le dé frutos en un futuro y para que la clientela queD. satisfecha; Ella quiere estar a disposición D. lo que sus clientes necesiten y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, maíz y mayor cantidad D. leña antes que finalice el verano, dado que en invierno incrementa su valor y así el valor D. reventa resulta ganancioso para Rosa. Es así como Rosa piensa atraer nuevos clientes e incrementar su negocio; pues  esto le pueD. asegurar la estabilidad económica D. su familia.
texts.en: Rosa Refugio lives with her life partner and has a business selling staple grains and firewood in an accessible location that is visited by many customers each day.  She is eager to please, and always has what her customers need.  For Rosa, what matters is the love that she puts into her work, so that it will bear fruit for her in the future, and so that her customers leave satisfied.  Rosa wants to be ready to give her customers everything they need, and for this reason she requests a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase staple grains, rice, beans, corn and a large quantity of firewood before the summer ends since prices will go up after that, and thus allow her to benefit.  In this way, Rosa plans to attract new customers and increase her business, which will help to ensure the economic stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy firewood, grains, rice, beans and corn.

loans.name: Norma Gladis

texts.es:
Norma Gladis, de 35 años de edad, habita en su propia casa con sus 5 hijos por los cuales se esfuerza día con día para sacar adelante. Norma es una mujer emprendedora que ha hecho de su hogar un negocio el cual consiste en la venta de cosméticos y perfumería, a la vez también vende productos por catalogo, reside en un lugar muy transitado por el èxito en las ventas de Norma. Ella se esfuerza por mantener surtido su negocio ya que de esta manera los clientes la prefieren y cada día la buscan mas porque saben que siempre encuentra lo que buscan. Para norma es muy importante mantener activo su negocio ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta y por ello ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a integral con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera lograra mejorar su calidad de vida. 

El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de diferentes tipos perfumes tanto para hombre como para mujer, cremas (para el cuerpo, cara, manos y cabello), desodorantes, y variedad de  cosméticos que  sean atractivos para los clientes, entre otros productos que permitan a traer a mas clientela. Con esto ella espera obtener mayores ganancias y de esta forma poder ayudar a su amada familia que únicamente depende de ella.
texts.en:
Norma Gladis is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her five children for whom she strives every day to move forward.  She is an enterprising woman who has established a home-based business selling cosmetics and perfumes.  In addition, Norma sells products through catalogs. Since she lives in a place with a lot of transportation and visitors passing through, she has had a lot of success. She tries to maintain the inventory of her business.  As a result, her customers prefer to do business with her because she always has what they need.  It is very important for Norma to maintain an active business because it is the only source of income that she has.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral.  With her faith in God, she hopes to improve her quality of life.  

This loan will be invested in her business by purchasing different types of colognes for men and women, crèmes (for body, face, hands, and hair), deodorants, a variety of cosmetics that are popular with her customers, as well as other products that will help increase her clientele.  She hopes to generate more income so that she can support her beloved family since she is the sole breadwinner.

loans.use: to purchase colognes, crèmes, deodorants, cosmetics, and other popular products.

loans.name: Oswaldo Benjamín

texts.es: Oswaldo Benjamín L. G. vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijas en San Pedro Perulapan del departamento de Cuscatlán. El se dedica a la venta de medicinas y tiene mucha clientela porque es muy conocido en el lugar, es muy servicial con las personas que lo visitan y siempre tiene lo que buscan por supuesto de buena calidad y a un buen precio. Para Oswaldo su trabajo lo alimenta y al mismo tiempo es su medicina, que siempre lo ayuda a salir adelante con su familia. El quiere seguir acrecentando su negocio y quiere satisfacer la necesidad de los clientes es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar medicinas de todo tipo para  así mantener a flote el negocio. Oswaldo espera que su fuente de ingresos le ayude a mantener una seguridad económica en su hogar.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Benjamín L. G. lives with his life partner and their two daughters in San Pedro Perulapan, department of Cuscatlan. He sells medicines and has many customers because he is well known locally. He is very helpful towards those who visit and he always has what they are looking for, of course of good quality at a good price. For Oswaldo his work feeds him and it's also his medicine, as it helps him support his family. 

He wants to continue to grow his business and meet his clients' needs, and that's why he's requesting INTEGRAL a loan that will enable him to buy all kinds of medicines to  keep the business afloat. Oswaldo hopes that his revenue stream will help him maintain his family's financial security.

loans.use: to buy all kinds of medicines.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa P. tiene instalado un puesto de ropa en el mercado de Colon, departamento de La Libertad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en dicho mercado, Blanca es una mujer emprendedora que nunca dice no al trabajo siempre se encuentra activa y cuando recibe a los clientes que la visitan los espera con una gran sonrisa en el rostro y les ofrece el mejor servicio; porque el trabajo hecho con gusto y con amor trae los mejores beneficios. Blanca quiere aumentar su clientela y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa usada de todo estilo para que la gente se encuentre satisfecha. Blanca quiere lograr que su negocio prospere en un futuro para mantener siempre activa su fuente de trabajo y tener en su hogar una seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa P. has a clothing stall in the market of Colon, department of La Libertad. In the market she sells used clothing. Blanca is an enterprising woman who never says no to work. She is always active. She welcomes her customers with a big smile on her face and offers them the best service, because work done with joy and love brings the best benefits. 

Blanca wants to increase her customer base and that is why she is requesting INTEGRAL a loan that will enable her to buy used clothing of different styles to satisfy the demand from the people. Blanca wants her business to thrive in the future to keep her job source always active and maintain the financial security of her home.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothes.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian runs a business venture in the retail sector specializing in rice retail for the local communities. She is 48 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Talairon, Oroquieta City. Vivian has been engaged in her business for five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more sacks of rice for her rice retail business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice for her rice retail business.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en: Guillerma is 46 years old and married with two children. Guillerma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari sari store. Guillerma has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, shampoo, diapers, canned foods, bread, etc. In the future, Guillerma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a cosmetics sales business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more beauty supplies for her cosmetics sales business. Merlinda has been in this business for 12 years. Merlinda earns additional income selling RTW [Ready To Wear] clothing.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty supplies to sell to customers.

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia is married and runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She works hard to support her five children. 

Abundia is requesting a 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Abundia is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove she is not only saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rug-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past eight years and also earns additional income from selling used clothing.

Mercedita has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy rug-making materials. In the future, she hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make rugs

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 44 years old and married with three school-aged children. She is from the village of Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City. To make a living, Annabelle runs a general store in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for four years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. 

Annabelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more products such as canned and dry goods and soap and shampoo. Annabelle plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

location.town: Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and married with two children, one of whom attends school. She works very hard to provide for her children. For the past ten years, Evelyn has run a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned food, sugar and other miscellaneous items.

Evelyn is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to continue to educate her children and send them to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Maicel

texts.en:
Maicel is 27 years old and married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur and for the past five years has run a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. 

Maicel is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more clothing and products to sell. In the future, Maicel would like to save enough money to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear clothing to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 41 years old and married with five children. Marissa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy rice, canned goods and supplies for her store. Marissa has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Marissa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice, canned foods and supplies for her store.

loans.name: Woza Group

texts.en:
Nelisiwe is 43 years old and widowed with five children between the ages of 15 and 26 years old. She also cares for two grandchildren. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo she is standing on the far left raising her hand.

Nelisiwe's been in business for six years selling chicken, fruit and chips. She says that the challenge to her business is having customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time. Nelisiwe requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses (WDB) and Kiva to buy chickens, chips and fruit. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her generate profits and will help her take care of her children. 

In the future, she would like to see her business grow and to have other products to sell and a shelter to sell in. Through WDB she has managed to put her children through higher education, which is expensive, and she will be able to change the style of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens, fruits and chips.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 39 years old and married with four children, 3 of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Liza buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as pants, shorts and blouses.

Liza has been in this business for 8 years.  In the future, Liza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ready-to-wear items such as pants, shorts and blouses

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 58 years old and married with three children.  Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries for her store and school supplies.

Marilou has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, toothpaste, and school supplies.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her sari-sari store and school supplies

loans.name: Vena

texts.en:
Vena is 26 years old and married with two children.

Vena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari or general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of  PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries for her store.

Vena has borrowed and repaid 5 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from farming and raising pigs.

Vena aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her sari-sari store to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 58 years old and married with four children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari or general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 6 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Julieta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 47 years old and married with three children.

Beverly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 19,500 through NWTF to fund her store.

Beverly has borrowed and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Beverly aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Blesilda

texts.en:
Blesilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling of cosmetic products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Blesilda earns additional income from frozen foods. Blesilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

Blesilda is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of beauty supplies to sell through her cosmetics buying and selling business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of beauty supplies to sell

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Heng E. is a 31-year-old mother who has two children, who are still young and attend school. Heng E. is a domestic rice cultivator in Kompong Cham province. She has been working in this sector since she was single. In order to generate more income, Heng E.’s husband works in construction. Heng E. has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase piglets, chicken, and feed and to build a new cage for her animals. Heng E. believes she can increase her daily income by using Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, chicken, and feed and to build a new cage for her animals.

loans.name: Ma. Remedios

texts.en:
Ma. Remedios is 55 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Remedios has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Ma. Remedios requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to customers

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Amalia earns additional income from a sari-sari store and pig fattening. Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell to customers for her Firewood Retailing business. She dreams of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of firewood to sell

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 45 years old and married with four children. Beatriz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Beatriz has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns income from pig fattening. Beatriz aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and feed for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosemaridel

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosemaridel works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from cosmetics. Rosemaridel is borrowing 19,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy an additional sidecar for her motorcycle for her tricycle-transport business.

Rosemaridel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy an additional sidecar for her tricycle business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old and married, with 3 children who all attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 21,000  through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat and other equipment.

Josephine has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for her fishing boat and other equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelsie

texts.en:
Nelsie is 37 years old and married, with two children who both attend school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Nelsie has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell.

Nelsie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Nelsie would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted fish to sell

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is 58 years old and married with six children.

Maxima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari, or variety, store in the Philippines.  She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell in her store.

Maxima has borrowed and repaid 4 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maxima aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sren

texts.en:
Sren S. is 27 years old, married and devoted to two children who are students at the local public school. She stays at home to manage the family and is also involved in planting rice crop on her farmland for income. She is married to 29-year-old Vor Sovann, who helps support the family by running a motor taxi.

Sren S. thinks that it is time to open new small business in order to increase their income to support the family. Sren S. said she doesn’t have enough funds to run her retail business. So she is applying for a loan to buy some goods like cooking ingredients, water, shampoo, and other items for sale. With this loan, she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy water, shampoo, cooking ingredients and other items for retail sale.

loans.name: Gulom

texts.en: Gulom has been in the farming business for 13 years and he has much experience. He is married and has three children. His wife helps him in his business and together, they work hard to make a profit for the feeding of their children. Gulom would like to get a loan of $1,500 for purchasing fertilizers and pesticide, which allows him to get a good harvest and make a good profit. He will invest his profit for expanding his business and for celebrating the rite of the circumcision of his son. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is from the village of P-2 Mobod, Oroquiety City. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth runs a general store. She has been engaged in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month. She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from PMPC. 

Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP with which she will purchase more products such as dry goods, canned goods, toothpaste, soap etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Hloniphile Group

texts.en:
Bongekile, left with hand raised, is 37 years and single with two children, 4 and 13 years old and also takes care of two relatives. She has run a retail store in Empangeni in Kwa Zulu Natal, South Africa for two years. She makes bead jewelry and traditional skirts, and also sells perfume and braai (assorted meat) packs. She also receives a government child support grant. She says that she has not faced any challenges to her business since she does not sell on credit. 

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy perfumes and beads. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her build a house for her family. In future she would like to own her own shelter to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and beads

loans.name: Mut

texts.en: Mut Y. has four children: three of them are single and one is married and living in a separate house. Mut Y. and her husband work together cultivating rice in Kompong Cham province. From this, they earn around $3 a day to use for family expenses. She will be using this loan to plant cucumbers and corn, and she hopes she can sell them in the local market for extra income when they are mature.

loans.use: to plant cucumbers and corn.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

For the past six years, he has operated a carpentry business. He sells from home to his neighbors and passersby. In addition Said faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation from rural areas to his place of operation. He dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of timber in his area. 

With the Kshs 40,000 Saidi wants to purchase timber for his carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 30 years old, married, and four children between the ages of 10 and 20 years old. She has three years of experience selling sorghum in her market. Jacqueline is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sorghum to sell. With this profits, she will build a house for her business and reinvest in her enterprise in order to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to purchase more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a married man with two children, one of whom attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a video hall business. His potential customers are local neighbours and workers from Coast coconut farms. Hussein dreams of providing the best possible service to his clients in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase furniture, fans and chairs for his video hall. He decided to work with Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture, fans and chairs for his video hall.

loans.name: Katwe United Women's Group

texts.en: N. Jamidah, 53, runs a clothes sales business in Katwe-Kampala. The widowed mother of two, she has been in this business for close to six years. Jamidah was initially a farmer and used savings from her farming business to put down the roots of her current business. She says this business generates her 100,000 shillings a week as profits. With this loan she will purchase more bales of clothes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar, cakes and rice for the shop.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He takes care of the family with the help of his wife who is also a businesswoman. Their dream is to educate their children up to university, since they did not get the chance to go to school. He has been operating a retail shop for eight years and this has facilitated him in educating his children and building a semi-permanent house, although he still has the challenges of limited finances, making it difficult to meet the demands of his customers. His dream is to become a wholesaler. Justus needs the loan to buy soap and millet flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and millet flour to sell.

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana is from the village of Lobogon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 66 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a business venture in the food sector, selling fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for thirty years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities. 

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Emeliana is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP with which she will purchase more fish to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 30 years old and married to Lucy, who also contributes to the family income. He has been running his motorcycle business for a period of about two years with an income of approximately $64 per month. 

This is his first loan cycle after being introduced to KADET by a staff member. He wants to use the loan to buy a piece of land jointly with other group members. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and to expand his transport business.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land with his group members

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a forty-one-year-old married man with eight children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For six years he has been running a drug shop after resigning from being a government security officer.  With the income generated, he has been able to provide the basics for his family.

He has a challenge of limited funds to buy the necessary drugs and his dream is to own a pharmacy.  John intends to use the credit facility to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell

loans.name: Perpetue

texts.en:
Perpetue is 40 years old and is married with three children between the ages of 12 and 20 years old. Perpetue has 12 years of experience selling curtains, covers and sheets.

Perpetue has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more linens to sell. With the profits, Perpetue will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more linens like curtains, covers and sheets to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a fifty-three-year-old single mother of two children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She has been taking care of her children all by herself and one is through with university while the other one is in senior year six.

For six years she has been selling food in markets.  She started as an employee and later set up her own stall and business has been profitable despite challenges in price fluctuation. Her dream is to own a food store.  Margret wants the money to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell

loans.name: Digao
